3dmoo.name: 3dmoo
3dmoo.author: normmatt and ichfly
3dmoo.description: 3dmoo is an open-source Nintendo 3DS emulator released on May 17, 2014 for Windows and Linux. It can run commercial Nintendo 3DS games, albeit very, very slowly, and most games frequently crash.

3dnes.name: 3DNes
3dnes.author: geod
3dnes.description: 3DNes is an emulator that renders Nintendo Entertainment System games in 3D with a VR option on the way. If you really want to see something a bit special, it's definitely worth trying this emulator.

3doplay.name: 3DOplay
3doplay.author: Viktor Ivanov
3doplay.description: 3DOplay is a Russian emulator for the Panasonic 3DO forked from the FreeDO sources.

4do.name: 4DO
4do.author: JohnnyDude & Viktor
4do.description: 4DO is an open-source, low-level emulator based on the FreeDO source code. This is one of the best emulators for the 3DO.

80five.name: MarioNES / 80five
80five.author: Gary Boyes
80five.description: MarioNES / 80five is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator.

88va.name: 88VA Eternal Grafx
88va.author: shinra
88va.description: 88VA Eternal Grafx is a NEC PC-88VA, NEC PC-88VA2, NEC PC-9801VM, NEC PC-9801VX and Epson PC-286 (PC-98 compatible personal computer) emulator based on Neko Project II. NOTE: Website and Help File are in Japanese.

ace.name: Another Capcom (play system) Emulator
ace.author: friol
ace.description: ace is an emulator capable of running a selection of games from the Capcom CPS1 and CPS2, the SNK NeoGeo and the Sega System 16 and System 18. The project was discontinued as the author had a hard drive crash and lost the source code.

ace32.name: ACE32
ace32.author: Paul Robson
ace32.description: ACE 32 - A Dos emulator for the Jupiter ACE.

activegs.name: ActiveGS
activegs.author: Olivier Goguel
activegs.description: ActiveGS is an Apple IIGS emulator.

adripsx.name: AdriPSX
adripsx.author: Roor Makurosu
adripsx.description: AdriPSX is a Sony PlayStation emulator, It can run several games designed for the PSX console on a PC running Windows 9x, ME, NT, 2000, XP or DOS. its perfomance depends heavily on your PC configuration, and what kind of PSX game you are trying to run. AdriPSX will never substitute a true PSX but it can give you the excitement to run your favorite games on your PC. Many games will not work properly or not work at all.

adviem.name: AdViEmulator
adviem.author: justburn
adviem.description: AdViEmulator is an Entex Adventure Vision with debugging capabilities.

aes4all.name: AES4ALL
aes4all.author: Chui
aes4all.description: AES4ALL is a SNK Neo Geo AES and MVS emulator. NOTE: To use AES4ALL (NEO4ALL/AES), you need to convert typical ZIP-compressed NEOGEO roms. The 'convertneo' command-line tool allows this conversion of supported games. First, put all files of NEOGEO bios (uncompress neogeo.zip of MAME) and 'aes-bios.bin' file of NEOGEO home to bios directory. Then, go to Windows CMD and execute 'convertneo.exe' with filename of ZIP as parameter, for example: C:\temp\convertneo> convertneo.exe migame.zip - If all are ok you will have a 'migame.aes' file for playing with AES4ALL.

agat.name: Agat
agat.author: Odintsov O.A
agat.description: Agat Emulator is an Apple II and Agat 7/9 (Soviet clones) emulator. Its GUI uses the Russian language.

ages.name: WinAGES
ages.author: Quinntesson
ages.description: WinAGES is a Sega 32x, Game Gear, Genesis / Megadrive, Master System and Sega CD emulator.

aipc.name: AIPC (Apple in a PC)
aipc.author: Keonwoo Kim aka sosaria7
aipc.description: AIPC (Apple in PC) is an Apple IIe Emulator.

akiko.name: Akiko
akiko.author: Andreas Falkenhahn
akiko.description: Akiko is a CD32 and CDTV emulator for Windows. It runs with the help of a CD32/CDTV adapted version of WinUAE and with the help of the Install2001 system which was also used in the Amiga version of the CD32 Games Install Kit.

alice32.name: Alice32
alice32.author: James the Animal Tamer
alice32.description: Alice32 is a Matra-Hachette Alice32 emulator.

altirra.name: Altirra
altirra.author: Phaeron
altirra.description: Altirra is an emulator that simulates the hardware of the Atari 8-bit computer systems, including the Atari 800, 800XL, and 130XE computers.

anex86.name: Anex86
anex86.author: A.N.
anex86.description: Anex86 is a PC-286, 386, 486 and 586 emulator.

apfemuw.name: APF EMUW
apfemuw.author: Enrique Collado
apfemuw.description: APF_EMUW emulates in a PC a computer APF Imagination Machine.

apple1.name: Apple 1
apple1.author: Peter Rittwage
apple1.description: The Apple I emulator has been updated a little using SDL so it runs on modern hardware/Windows. vPCB for DOS is lost forever, but the project has been revamped for the Palm platform.

appler.name: APPLER
appler.author: Emil Dotchevski and Alexander Patalenski
appler.description: Programmed in 16-bit assembly, and emulates sound through the PC speaker. Very compatible with ][+ applications; includes an attractive interface.

applewin.name: AppleWin
applewin.author: AppleWin Team
applewin.description: AppleWin is an Apple II emulator.

aprnes.name: April NES
aprnes.author: erspicu_brox
aprnes.description: AprNes Nintendo Red and White Machine Simulator.

aqemu.name: AqEmu
aqemu.author: Kenny Millar
aqemu.description: AqEmu was the first Mattel Aquarius Emulator.

aranym.name: Atari on Any Machine
aranym.author: The ARAnyM  Team
aranym.description: ARAnyM (Atari Running on Any Machine) is an Atari ST, TT and Falcon emulator. NOTE: To run AFROS (OS downloadable from Author's Website) double-click 'afros.bat' after placing AFROS in it's own folder in the same location as 'aranym.exe'.

arcem.name: ArcEm
arcem.author: pnaulls and ralph
arcem.description: ArcEm is an Acorn Archimedes emulator

archie.name: Archie
archie.author: Chris-o
archie.description: Archie is an Acorn Archimedes emulator for DOS. It is freeware and is not to be distributed with OS ROMs or to be modified or sold.

arculator.name: Arculator
arculator.author: Tom Walker
arculator.description: Arculator emulates an old-style Archimedes (A3xx,A4xx,A3000,A540) with an ARM2 or ARM3, 4, 8 or 16 megabytes of RAM, and a single floppy drive.

arnimedes.name: ARNIMEDES
arnimedes.author: Oliver Lenz
arnimedes.description: ARNIMEDES is an Amstrad CPC emulator. NOTE: Emulator appears to only run in Fullscreen mode.

arnold.name: Arnold
arnold.author: Kevin Thacker
arnold.description: Arnold is an Amstrad/Schneider CPC, Plus/CPC+ and VEB Mikroelektronik KC Compact emulator.

ascd.name: ASCD
ascd.author: Aley Keprt
ascd.description: ASCD is a Sam Coupe and Sinclair ZX Spectrum emulator.

aspectrum.name: Aspectrum
aspectrum.author: Santiago Romero Iglesias and The Aspectrum Team
aspectrum.description: Aspectrum is a Sinclair ZX Spectrum emulator. NOTE: Runs in Full-Screen mode ONLY. To access the Menu, press the 'ESC' key. To change the language (Spanish <-> English), press the 'F8' key.

atari800.name: Atari800
atari800.author: The Atari800 Development Team
atari800.description: Atari800 is an Atari 800, 800XL, 130XE and 5200 emulator for Unix, Linux, Amiga, MS-DOS, Atari TT/Falcon, MS Windows, MS WinCE and systems running the SDL library.

atari800winplus.name: Atari800Win-PLus
atari800winplus.author: Marcin Lewandoski aka Jaskier
atari800winplus.description: Atari800Win Plus is an emulator that is based off the Atari800 kernel and the Atari800Win sources. It features nearly 100% compatability, stereo sound, multiple video modes, support for compressed disk images, and MUCH more.

atariplusplus.name: atari++
atariplusplus.author: Thomas Richter
atariplusplus.description: atari++ is an emulator for (now rather aged) Atari 8 bit computers. It emulates the Atari800, Atari400, the 800XL and 600XL, the 65XE and 130XE and the Atari 5200 Game Console. The emulation is cycle-precise, that is 'on the fly' modifications of chip registers will be visible on the screen immediately, emulating even programs using horizontal kernel tricks correctly.

atom.name: ACORN ATOM
atom.author: Wouter Ras
atom.description: Welcome to the Acorn ATOM software emulator for PC's. This program enables you to run most of the original Acorn ATOM software on your PC.

atomulator.name: Atomulator
atomulator.author: Tom Walker
atomulator.description: Atomulator is an emulator of an Acorn Atom - the first micro from Acorn in 1980. It emulates a 12+16k Atom with colour board, disc pack, and optional BBC BASIC mode.

aurex2.name: Aurex2
aurex2.author: Fumihiko MACHIDA
aurex2.description: Aurex is a Ruputer emulator, It supports several applications & various games.

basiliskii.name: Basilisk II
basiliskii.author: Christian Bauer aka cebix
basiliskii.description: Basilisk II is an Apple 68k Macintosh emulator.

beebem.name: BeebEm
beebem.author: Mike Wyatt, David Adam Gilbert and Others
beebem.description: BeebEm is a BBC Micro and Master 128 emulator. It enables you to run BBC Micro software on your PC. BeebEm should work on most PC systems running Windows XP or later.

bem.name: B-em
bem.author: Tom Walker
bem.description: B-em is a BBC Model A, B, B+, Master 128, Master 512, Master Turbo and Master Compact emulator. The relevant ROMs are required to use the 68516 Coprocessor.

bfmulator.name: BFMulator
bfmulator.author: Juergen Buchmueller, Mike Balfour, Howie Cohen, Oliver Galibert
bfmulator.description: BFMulator is a emulator for bellfruit MPU's.

bgb.name: BGB
bgb.author: Bas Steendijk
bgb.description: BGB is a Gameboy emulator, a program that lets you play Gameboy and Gameboy Color games on a pc. It does this with many features that give a good gameplay experience, such as gamepad support, high quality sound and graphics, smooth Vsync animation, and low latency. In addition, it contains a debugger that lets you analyze/look into the emulation, create cheat codes, and assist in creating and modifying roms. Because of BGB's high emulation accuracy, if your rom works in BGB, it will most likely work on hardware too.

bizhawk.name: BizHawk
bizhawk.author: BizHawk Team
bizhawk.description: BizHawk is a A multi-system emulator written in C#. BizHawk provides nice features for casual gamers such as full screen, and joypad support in addition to full rerecording and debugging tools for all system cores.

blastem.name: BlastEm
blastem.author: Mike Pavone
blastem.description: BlastEm is a Sega Genesis emulator.

bliss.name: Bliss
bliss.author: Kyle Davis
bliss.description: Bliss is an Intellivision emulator which allows you to play Intellivision games without an Intellivision.

bloodswan.name: BLooDsWan
bloodswan.author: Blood Soft
bloodswan.description: BLooDsWan is a Bandai Wonderswan and Wonderswan Color emulator based on Cygne.

bluemsx.name: blueMSX
bluemsx.author: Daniel Vik
bluemsx.description: blueMSX is an MSX, MSX2, MSX2+ and MSXturboR emulator. Almost all MSX machines like the ColecoVision console, the Sega SG-1000 console, the Sega SC-3000 and SF-7000 computers and the Spectravideo SVI318/328 computers are also supported.

boycottadv.name: BoycottAdvance
boycottadv.author: Julien FRELAT aka Gollum
boycottadv.description: BoycottAdvance is a Game Boy Advance emulator.

bsnes.name: BSNES
bsnes.author: Byuu
bsnes.description: bsnes is an emulator that began development on 2004-10-14. The purpose of this emulator is a bit different from others: it focuses on accuracy, debugging functionality, and clean code.

bsnesclassic.name: BSNES Classic
bsnesclassic.author: Devin Acker, Alex W. Jackson, Michal Ziabkowski and Maximilian Rehkopf
bsnesclassic.description: BSNES Classic is a Nintendo Entertainment System, Famicom, SNES, Super Famicom, Game Boy Color, BS-X Satellaview and Sufami Turbo emulator based on BSNES.

bsnesplus.name: BSNES+
bsnesplus.author: BSNES+ Team
bsnesplus.description: BSNES+ is a Nintendo Entertainment System, Famicom, SNES, Super Famicom, Game Boy Color, BS-X Satellaview and Sufami Turbo emulator based on BSNES Classic.

bsnessx2.name: BSNES-SX2
bsnessx2.author: LuigiBlood and Seu-kun
bsnessx2.description: BSNES-SX2 is a Nintendo Entertainment System, Famicom, SNES, Super Famicom, Game Boy Color, BS-X Satellaview and Sufami Turbo emulator based on BSNES v082.

bws.name: bws
bws.author: byuu
bws.description: bws is a Bandai WonderSwan and WonderSwan Color emulator.

bzsnes.name: bZSNES
bzsnes.author: byuu
bzsnes.description: bZSNES is a Nintendo SNES and Super Famicom emulator based on BSNES containing the optional inaccuracies of ZSNES. It was released as an April Fool's joke.

c4pc.name: C4PC
c4pc.author: Tim Schuerewegen aka FireFly
c4pc.description: This emulator is not intended to be used to PLAY / RUN / USE, but to TEST Cybiko software with. Only experienced Cybiko software developers should use this software. The emulation is very unstable and does NOT represent the Cybiko device/games/apps in any way. Hence, many games/apps don't work, which isn't the case on a REAL Cybiko.

calcem.name: CalcEm
calcem.author: David Eriksson
calcem.description: CalcEm is a Texas Instruments TI-82, TI-83 and TI-85 emulator.

calice.name: Calice32
calice.author: David Raingeard
calice.description: Calice is an emulator that is capable of playing almost all SNK Neo Geo ROMs plus, Sony ZiNc ZN1 and ZN2, Capcom CPS1 and CPS2 and all Sega System 16/18 ROMs. One of its cons is that it lacks image enhancements that Kawaks and Nebula have. It also requires that you run your desktop in 16 bit color rather than 32 bit.

callus.name: Callus95
callus.author: Bloodlust Software
callus.description: Callus is a DirectX based Capcom CPS1 emulator that currently runs a selection of games.

caprice32.name: CaPriCe32
caprice32.author: Ulrich Doewich
caprice32.description: Caprice32 is a software emulator of the Amstrad CPC 8bit home computer series. The emulator faithfully imitates the CPC464, CPC664, and CPC6128 models. By recreating the operations of all hardware components at a low level, the emulator achieves a high degree of compatibility with original CPC software.

ccs64.name: CCS64
ccs64.author: Per Hkan Sundell
ccs64.description: CCS64 is a Commodore 64 Emulator for PC and also in the future other platforms. It was developed by me, Per Hkan Sundell, as my Master Thesis at my university in 1995 and have been expanded a lot since then. My personal  interest in the C64 has been very intensive since 1983 when I was spending nearly all my time with it, and I was deeply involved in the so called 'Scene'. When I later in 1987 bought my Amiga 500, I missed the old good times I had with my C64 and since then I have tried my very best to make all the old programs to work on my new machines.

cdiemulator.name: CD-i
cdiemulator.author: CD-i Fan
cdiemulator.description: CCS64 is a Commodore 64 Emulator for PC and also in the future other platforms. It was developed by me, Per Hkan Sundell, as my Master Thesis at my university in 1995 and have been expanded a lot since then. My personal  interest in the C64 has been very intensive since 1983 when I was spending nearly all my time with it, and I was deeply involved in the so called 'Scene'. When I later in 1987 bought my Amiga 500, I missed the old good times I had with my C64 and since then I have tried my very best to make all the old programs to work on my new machines.

cemu.name: Cemu
cemu.author: Cemu Team
cemu.description: Cemu is a highly experimental WiiU emulator. NOTE: Cemu is 64bit ONLY.

chankast.name: Chankast
chankast.author: baktery, unai, garrofi and elsemi
chankast.description: Chankast is a Sega Dreamcast emulator.

citra.name: Citra
citra.author: Multiple Contributors
citra.description: Citra is an experimental open-source Nintendo 3DS emulator/debugger written in C++. Although it is slow at this time, it is constantly being improved. Citra's features include better visual output, debugging homebrew, with planned controller support.

classic99.name: Classic99
classic99.author: M Brent and Tursi
classic99.description: Classic99 is a Texas Instruments TI-99/4A and TI-99/4 emulator.

cogwheel.name: Cogwheel
cogwheel.author: Ben Ryves
cogwheel.description: A software emulator primarily for 8-bit Sega hardware, such as the Sega Master System, Sega Game Gear and SG-1000. The ColecoVision is also supported.

colem.name: ColEm
colem.author: Marat Fayzullin
colem.description: ColEm is a portable emulator of the old ColecoVision videogame console. It should run most ColecoVision games and supports Coleco's SuperAction controllers with spin wheels.

coloremu.name: Colour Emu
coloremu.author: Burkhard Lehner & Stephan Scholz
coloremu.description: The emulator runs BASIC as well as machine code programs, even if they do take advantage of special hardware. The speed is adjustable, if you wan't to cheat in some games.

comeback64.name: Come Back 64
comeback64.author: D Luxen
comeback64.description: CB64 is a software emulator for the C64 Computer.

coolcv.name: CoolCV
coolcv.author: Oscar Toledo G.
coolcv.description: CoolCV is a Coleco Colecovision, Coleco Adam and Sega SG-1000 emulator. NOTE: To run a ROM you have to drag and drop it onto the emulator.

copacabana.name: CoPaCabana
copacabana.author: Regis Nicolas
copacabana.description: CoPaCabana is an Amstrad CPC emulator.

cpcalive.name: CpcAlive
cpcalive.author: Unknown
cpcalive.description: CpcAlive is a programming environment Amstrad CPC compatible for graphics animations creation. The originality of the emulator is that it can work with all media wich accept the Dos emulator "Dosbox".

cpce.name: CPCE
cpce.author: Cesar Nicolas Gonzalez
cpce.description: CPCE is an Amstrad CPC emulator.

cpcem.name: CPC-em
cpcem.author: Tom Walker
cpcem.description: This Amstrad CPC emulator that has been around for awhile by Tom Walker. It emulates Z80, video emulation, disc emulation, sound emulation, a GUI, SVGA, joysticks, and more.

cpcemu.name: CPCemu
cpcemu.author: Marco Vieth
cpcemu.description: CPCEMU emulates an Amstrad CPC on your computer. You need at least an AT 386 with VGA graphics.

cpmbox.name: CP/M Box
cpmbox.author: habi
cpmbox.description: CP/M Box is an Amstrad PCW series emulator.

cps3emulator.name: Capcom Play System 3
cps3emulator.author: ElSemi
cps3emulator.description: Capcom Play System 3 Emulator is a Capcom Play System 3 emulator.

cpspemu.name: CPSPEmu
cpspemu.author: Soywiz
cpspemu.description: CPSPEmu is a Sony Playstation Portable emulator.

creativision.name: creatiVision
creativision.author: cvemu
creativision.description: creatiVision Emulator is an emulator for the VTech Creativision, Dick Smith Wizzard, Hanimex Rameses, VTech Laser 2001, Salora Manager and homebrew CSL Cartridge.

cxbx.name: Cxbx
cxbx.author: Echelon9
cxbx.description: Cxbx is a Microsoft XBox emulator. This version is a fork of the original Cxbx.

cxbxreloaded.name: Cxbx Reloaded
cxbxreloaded.author: Luke Usher
cxbxreloaded.description: Cxbx-Reloaded is a Microsoft XBox emulator. This version is a fork of the original Cxbx.

cygne.name: Cygne
cygne.author: Dox
cygne.description: Cygne is a Bandai Wonderswan and Wonderswan Color emulator.

daedalus.name: Daedalus
daedalus.author: StrmnNrmn
daedalus.description: Daedalus is a Nintendo N64 emulator.

daphne.name: Daphne
daphne.author: Matt Ownby
daphne.description: Daphne is a LaserDisc Arcade Game emulator. As at v1.0.0 it can play the following games: Astron Belt, Badlands, Bega's Battle, Cliff Hanger, Cobra Command, Dragon's Lair, Dragon's Lair II: Timewarp, Esh's Aurunmilla, Galaxy Ranger, GP World, Interstellar, M.A.C.H. 3, Road Blaster, Space Ace, Star Blazer, Super Don Quix-ote, Thayer's Quest and Us vs Them.

dcalice.name: DCALICE
dcalice.author: Daniel Coulom
dcalice.description: DCALICE is a Tandy MC10 and Matra-Hachette Alice emulator. NOTE: The emulator toolbar and all documentation is in French.

dcexel.name: DCEXEL
dcexel.author: Daniel Coulom
dcexel.description: DCEXEL is an emulator for Exelvision 8bit computers: EXL100, Exeltel, Exetel VS, VX Exeltel Amper and Comtel. The Help File is in French.

dchector.name: DCHector
dchector.author: Daniel Coulom
dchector.description: DCHector is an Interact Home Computer System emulator and several other computers including the Victor and the Hector.

dcmicro.name: DCMicroColor
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer
dcmicro.author: Daniel Coulom
dcmicro.description: DCMicroColor is a Tandy MC10 and Matra-Hachette Alice 4K emulator.

dcmo5.name: DCMO5
dcmo5.author: Daniel Coulom
dcmo5.description: DCMO5 is a Thomson MO5 emualtor. Screenshot from Author's Website.

dcmoto.name: DCMOTO
dcmoto.author: Daniel Coulom
dcmoto.description: DCMOTO is an emulator for all Thomson 8 bit computers: MO5, MO5E, German MO5E, MO5NR, MO6, Olivetti Prodest PC128, T9000, French QWERTY TO7, German QWERTY TO7, TO7/70, Arabic TO7/70, TO9, German TO9, TO8, TO8D and TO9+.

dcvg5k.name: DCVG5K
dcvg5k.author: Daniel Coulom
dcvg5k.description: DCVG5K is a Philips, Radiola and Schneider VG5000 emulator.

dega.name: Dega
dega.author: Dave
dega.description: Dega is a Sega Master System and Game Gear emulator.

demul.name: Demul
demul.author: Demul Team
demul.description: Demul is a Sega Dreamcast emulator which also emulates the arcade boards of Naomi 1, Naomi 2, Hikaru, and Atomiswave.

desmume.name: DesMuME
desmume.author: yopyop, DeSmuME team
desmume.description: DeSmuME is a freeware emulator for the NDS roms & Nintendo DS Lite and DSi games created by YopYop156. DeSmuME is also known as YopYop DS is written in C++ for Microsoft Windows and can play Nintendo DS homebrew and commercial nds roms. The emulator its self is in French (with full user translations to English and other languages). But even French version of DeSmuME is easy to navigate through menus as it has a similar users interface to DSemu. It supports many homebrew nds rom demoes as well as a handful of Wireless Multiboot demo nds roms. DeSmuME is also able to emulate nearly all of the commercial nds rom titles which other DS Emulators like iDeaS and Dualis aren't capable of running.

dgen.name: DGen
dgen.author: DGen was originally written by Dave. It was ported to SDL by Joe Groff and Phil K. Hornung. It was resurrected by tamentis in 2008 and is maintained by zamaz since september 2011.
dgen.description: DGen is a Sega Mega Drive and Genesis emulator.

dinoboy.name: DinoBoy
dinoboy.author: Prads
dinoboy.description: DinoBoy is a Nintendo Game Boy and Game Boy Color emulator.

directvms.name: DirectVMS
directvms.author: biggs
directvms.description: DirectVMS is a DirectX port of SoftVMS, an emulator for the Sega Dreamcast Visual Memory System.

dmgboy.name: DMGBoy
dmgboy.author: Pablo Gasco
dmgboy.description: DMGBoy (Dot Matrix Game Boy) is a Game Boy emulator written in C++. It uses wxWidgets for the user interface and SDL and portaudio for the audio. Is Cross-Platform: Windows, Linux and Mac OS X builds are available.

dolphin.name: Dolphin
dolphin.author: Dolphin team
dolphin.description: Dolphin is a GameCube and Wii emulator with high compatibility across the majority of titles for both platforms. It was first developed as closed source in 2003, and as open source since 2008.

dolwin.name: Dolwin
dolwin.author: Dolwin Team
dolwin.description: Dolwin is an open source Game Cube emulator fully written with dolwinC. Even though it's still under development you can still be able to boot and run some commercial games and a few demos. The zip file comes with a demo that you can play to test the emulator. This emulator has not been updated in roughly 5 years. Check it out though if you will.

dosbox.name: DOSBox
dosbox.author: Peter Veenstra (Qbix)
dosbox.description: DOSBox is a DOS-emulator that uses the SDL-library which makes DOSBox very easy to port to different platforms.

dpspemu.name: PSPEmu
dpspemu.author: Soywiz
dpspemu.description: PSPEmu is a Sony Playstation Portable emulator.

dream64.name: Dream64
dream64.author: tprodigy1
dream64.description: Dream64 is totally free, and developped just for fun. It can run most commercial games and a lot of tricky demos, by the way it is not yet as compatible as great emulators like Hoxs64 or CCS64.

dreamemu.name: DreamEmu
dreamemu.author: Lord Cheese
dreamemu.description: Dreamemu is an emulator for the Sega Dreamcast console. Dreamemu is in very early stages of development and currently discontinued.

dreamgba.name: DreamGBA
dreamgba.author: Kervin
dreamgba.description: DreamGBA is a Nintendo Game Boy Advance emulator.

dreamgbatng.name: DreamGBA TNG
dreamgbatng.author: Kervin
dreamgbatng.description: DreamGBA TNG is a Nintendo Game Boy Advance emulator based on DreamGBA. NOTE: Emulator is in Chinese. Controls are: Arrow (W, A, S, D) - Start (V) - Select (B) - ABLR ( J, K, U, I). Screenshot from http://www.starzaki.eu.org/~emukouncik/nr_online/e-k_28/e-k/ed8.htm.

dreamvmu.name: DreamVMU
dreamvmu.author: Michel Gerritse
dreamvmu.description: This project is the work of Gerrie, the author of Xega. All the hardware is not emulated and it's very buggy. The emulator was developed for fun and it will not go on, know that its sources are available, if someone is interested in resuming the project ...

dsp.name: DSP
dsp.author: Leniad
dsp.description: DSP is a multi-system emulator that emulates the following: Nintendo NES, Nintendo Game Boy and Game Boy Color, Coleco ColecoVision, Sharp Chip 8 and Super Chip 8,  Sega Master System, Sinclair Spectrum 16K, 48K, 128K, +2 and +2A/+3 and Amstrad CPC 464, 664 and 6128. It also emulates over 220 Arcade Machines (see Readme.txt for full list). NOTE: BIOS ROMs are not required but will improve emulation.

dsvz200.name: DSVZ200
dsvz200.author: The_Author and DynaChicken
dsvz200.description: ZiNc is an emulator for various arcade games which ran on modified Sony PlayStation hardware. It does not emulate any other games, including other 3D games.

dualis.name: Dualis
dualis.author: Mic
dualis.description: Dualis is a Nintendo DS emulator.

dve.name: DVE
dve.author: Keith Wilkins
dve.description: DVE (DOS Vectrex Emulator) is a GCE Vectrex emulator for DOS.

eightyone.name: EightyOne
eightyone.author: Michael D Wynne
eightyone.description: EightyOne is a multiple system emulator for these systems: Sinclair ZX80, ZX81, ZX Spectrum and QL, Amstrad Spectrums, Timex TS1000, TS1500, TC2048 and TS2068, Lambda 8300, Ringo R470, Microdigital TK-85 and Jupiter Cantab Jupiter Ace. It also emulates a couple of HomeBrew computers: ZX97 Lite and Spectrum SE.

electrem.name: ElectrEm
electrem.author: Thomas Harte
electrem.description: ElectrEm is an Acorn Electron emulator.

elf.name: RCS Elf
elf.author: Michael H Riley
elf.description: This program is a simulation of an early computer. The computer in this simulation is similar in design to the Elf computer project published in popular electronics in 1976. The base computer has 256 bytes of ram, 8 toggle switches for input, 4 hex displays to show the current address and 2 hex displays for data output.

elkulator.name: Elkulator
elkulator.author: Tom Walker
elkulator.description: Elkulator is an Acorn Electron emulator.

em7.name: EM-7
em7.author: Yoshimi
em7.description: EM7 is an emulator for the Fujitsu FM-7. NOTE: Emulator and Website are in Japanese.

emma02.name: EMMA 02
emma02.author: Marcel van Tongeren
emma02.description: the Emma 02 emulator is currently emulating the following computers: COMX-35, Cosmac Elf 2000, Cosmac VIP, Cosmac VIP II, Cosmicos, Cosmac Elf, Netronics Elf II, Quest Super Elf, Membership Card, VELF, RCA Studio II, Visicom COM-100, Victoy MPT-02, Cidelsa, Telmac TMC-600, Telmac 1800, Telmac 2000, Pecom 32 and 64, ETI 660

emu.name: EMU
emu.author: Tselikov
emu.description: EMU is a multi-system emulator for the following: ARM-HQ Bashkiria Bashkiria-2M, Agat-7, Alesta 520EH, Apogee, BC-0010, BC-0011M, Vector-06C, Vector start-1200, Christa-2, DCK, DCK-2, Irisha, Corvette, Scarce, Lick, Lvov PK-01, Micro 80, Microsha, MS 2721, Nairi, Ocean 240, Orion 128, Orion Pro Partner, PC 6128ts, PC 8000 Sura / West / Hobbies, PC 8002 Elf Search-1, Radio-86RK, specialist, specialist-MX, Junior, UT-88, MSX, MSX-2, Robotron 1715, Sinclair ZX Spectrum 48 and ZX Spectrum 128.

emu2001.name: Emulator2001
emu2001.author: Gavin Turner
emu2001.description: Emulator 2001 is a multi-system emulator that supports the Emerson Arcadia 2001, the VC 4000, the Elektor TV Games Computer and the VTech Laser-VZ300. For some systems all known ROMs are included.

emu64.name: Emu64
emu64.author: Thorsten Kattanek
emu64.description: Emu64 is a low-level emulation program, which emulates the Commodore 64. The operation of Emu64 is simpler than that of a real C64. All important functions are accessible with the mouse. Not only is the C64 was modeled, but also various extra hardware such as datasette, floppy drive or the use of modules.

emu7800.name: EMU7800
emu7800.author: Mike Murphy
emu7800.description: EMU7800 is an Atari 7800 emulator implemented using Microsoft's .NET platform. Most ProSystem (7800) and VCS (2600) titles run well. EMU7800 runs on Windows Vista SP2 and higher systems. Comes with several ROMs and required BIOSes.

emukon.name: Emukon
emukon.author: Martin and Robert Konrad
emukon.description: Emukon is a Sega Master System and Game Gear emulator.

emulator3000.name: Emulator3000
emulator3000.author: Eugene Troitskiy
emulator3000.description: Emulator 3000 (aka E3000) is an emulator of russian and foreign computers like Mikrosha, Vector-06C, Pyldin-601 and others.

emuz2000.name: EmuZ-2000
emuz2000.author: Toshio Fukui
emuz2000.description: EmuZ-2000 is a Sharp MZ-2000, MZ-2200, MZ-80B and MZ-80B2 emulator. All documentation is in Japanese.

emuzwin.name: EmuZWin
emuzwin.author: Vladimir Kladov
emuzwin.description: EmuZWin is a Sinclair ZX Spectrum and various Russian Clone emulator.

enter.name: ENTER
enter.author: Kevin Thacker
enter.description: ENTER is an Enterprise Computers Enterprise emulator.

ep128emu.name: ep128emu
ep128emu.author: Istvan Varga
ep128emu.description: ep128emu is a portable emulator of the Enterprise 64/128, ZX Spectrum 48/128, and Amstrad CPC 464/664/6128 computers

ep32.name: ep32
ep32.author: Kevin Thacker and Vincze Bela Gyorgy
ep32.description: ep32 is an Enterprise Computers Enterprise emulator.

epsxe.name: ePSXe
epsxe.author: Calb, Galtor, -Demo-
epsxe.description: ePSXe (enhanced PSX emulator) is a PlayStation video game console emulator for x86-based PC hardware with Microsoft Windows or Linux, as well as devices running Android. It was written by three authors, using the aliases calb, -Demo- and Galtor. ePSXe is closed source with the exception of the application programming interface (API) for its plug-ins.

euphoric.name: Euphoric
euphoric.author: Fabrice Francs
euphoric.description: Euphoric is a Dos/Windows emulator for the Oric computer

ex68.name: EX68
ex68.author: Yamama
ex68.description: EX68 is a Sharp X68000 emulator. NOTE: Emulator and Help Files are in Japanese.

exodus.name: Exodus
exodus.author: The Exodus Team
exodus.description: Exodus is a platform for emulating various devices. Currently it emulates the Sega Mega Drive.

fakenes.name: FakeNES
fakenes.author: randilyn, TRAC, Lord_Nightmare and KittyCat
fakenes.description: FakeNES is a portable, Open Source Nintendo Entertainment System and Famicom emulator.

fastz80.name: FastZ80
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer
fastz80.author: Lajos Kintli
fastz80.description: FastZ80 is a Tandy/Radio Shack TRS-80, HT-1080Z, EACA VideoGenie-1, PMC-80, Dick Smith System-80 and TRZ-80 emulator.

faux1.name: faux1
faux1.author: Edward Patel
faux1.description: Vace is a Jupiter Cantab Jupiter Ace emulator.

fbalpha.name: FinalBurn Alpha
fbalpha.author: The FinalBurn Alpha Team
fbalpha.description: FB Alpha is an arcade emulator supporting the following platforms: Capcom CPS1, CPS2 and CPS3, Cave, Data East DEC-0, DEC-8 and DECO IC16 based games, Galaxian based hardware, Irem M62, M63, M72, M90, M92 and M107 hardware, Kaneko 16, Konami, SNK NeoGeo, NMK16, Pacman based hardware, PGM, Psikyo 68EC020 and SH-2 based hardware, Sega System 1, System 16 (and similar), System 18, X-Board and Y-Board, Super Kaneko Nova System, Toaplan 1 and 2, Taito F2, X, Z and others. It has miscellaneous drivers for lots of other hardware and has WIP console drivers for Sega Megadrive/Genesis, ColecoVision, Sega SG-1000, Sega Master System/Game Gear and also PC-Engine/TurboGrafx 16/SuperGrafx.

fbalphashuffle.name: FinalBurn Alpha Shuffle
fbalphashuffle.author: KOF2112, Leaf, Creamymami
fbalphashuffle.description: FB Alpha Shuffle is an unofficial version based on FBA with many features.

fceux.name: FCEUX
fceux.author: FCEUX team
fceux.description: FCEUX is a cross platform, NTSC and PAL Famicom/NES emulator that is an evolution of the original FCE Ultra emulator. It is the favorite emu for recording/playing game movies.

firegb.name: FireGB
firegb.author: Frankablu
firegb.description: FireGB is a Nintendo Game Boy emulator.

fmsx.name: fMSX
fmsx.author: Marat Fayzullin
fmsx.description: fMSX is an MSX, MSX2 and MSX2+ emulator.

fnc.name: Fish 'N' Chips
fnc.author: hap
fnc.description: Fish 'N' Chips is a RCA Cosmac VIP and Chip-8 / SCHIP emulator.

freedo.name: FreeDo
freedo.author: awright69, felix_laz, troosh & jsammons
freedo.description: The FreeDO (closed-source) project exists to bring about an emulator or simulator capable of playing content originally made for the now-defunct and no longer commercially available 3DO Interactive Multiplayer, a 32-bit video game console that was licensed to manufacturers and developers, and marketed worldwide in the early to middle 1990s.

frodo.name: Frodo
frodo.author: Christian Bauer et al.
frodo.description: Frodo is a Commodore C64 emulator. It comes in 3 versions: Standard line-based emulation (frodo.exe - quick), Improved line-based emulation (frodopc.exe - slower) and the Single-Cycle emulation (frodosc.exe - slowest).

fs-uae.name: FS-UAE Amiga
fs-uae.author: Frode Solheim
fs-uae.description: FS-UAE is an Amiga emulator for Windows, Linux and Mac OS X based on UAE/WinUAE, with a focus on emulating games. Features include emulation of Amiga 500, 1200, 4000, CD32 and CDTV, perfectly smooth scrolling on 50Hz displays, support for floppy images in ADF and IPF formats, CD-ROM images in ISO or BIN/CUE format, mounting folders on your computer as Amiga hard drives, support for Picasso 96 drivers for high-color and high-resolution Workbench displays, and more....

funnymu.name: FunnyMU
funnymu.author: Pablo
funnymu.description: FunnyMu is a Funvision/Whizzard/Creativision emulator for Linux/Mac OS X and (sorta) Windows

fuse.name: Fuse (The Free Unix Spectrum Emulator)
fuse.author: Philip Kendall and the Fuse Team
fuse.description: Fuse (The Free Unix Spectrum Emulator) is a Sinclair ZX Spectrum, Timex TC2038, TC2068 and TS2068, Pentagon 128, "512" and 1024 and the Scorpion ZS 256 emulator.

futurepinball.name: Future Pinball
futurepinball.author: Christopher Leathley
futurepinball.description: Future Pinball is a real time Pinball Development System. It allows you to design and play your very own pinball simulation in True real time 3D. It uses Advanced Physics to provide the best possible Simulation of a true to life pinball machine.

galaxywin.name: Galaxy Win
galaxywin.author: Sadrzaj
galaxywin.description: Galaxy Win is an emulator for the Galaksija computer. It is a Windows port of the DOS GALAKSIJA emulator by Miodrag Jevremovic.

gamecomemu.name: Game.Com
gamecomemu.author: UNKNOWN
gamecomemu.description: Game.Com Emulator is the only (AFAIK) emulator for the Tiger Game.Com.

gamelad.name: GameLad
gamelad.author: Torbjrn Sderstedt
gamelad.description: GameLad is an emulator aimed at developers. This emulator is equipped with both a debugger and a disassembler and has the ability to throttle the emulation process on the fly. It also has the ability to run multiple virtual GameBoys at once. This emulator requires Direct X 8.0 or better and has link cable support.

gbeplus.name: GB Enhanced+
gbeplus.author: D S Baxter aka Shonumi
gbeplus.description: GB Enhanced+ is a Nintendo Game Boy, Game Boy Color and Game Boy Advance emulator.

gcemu.name: GCEmu
gcemu.author: Duddie, Tratax, Pete Bernert
gcemu.description: GCEmu is a very incomplete emulator for the Nintendo Gamecube. It uses recompilation techniques and other tricks to achieve a reasonable speed. Although emulation is very incomplete, it shows that 'it can be done' and can be done at a decent speed.

gcube.name: Gcube
gcube.author: Monk
gcube.description: Gcube is a very impressive GameCube emulator, available for Windows as well as Mac and Linux. Unfortunately Gcube does not have a graphical interface, and as such, is command-line driven, so reading the documentation would be advisable. Gcube is able to play into many games, but was unfortunately discontinued. However, Monk has released the source code to the emulator so any other developer is free to pick up the project and continue development.

gearsystem.name: GearSystem
gearsystem.author: Ignacio Sanchez
gearsystem.description: GearSystem is a Sega Master System and Game Gear emulator

geepee32.name: GeePee32
geepee32.author: Tim Schuerewegen
geepee32.description: GeePee32 is a Game-Park GP32 handheld console.

gekko.name: Gekko
gekko.author: shonumi
gekko.description: Gekko is a Nintendo GameCube emulator. NOTE: Screenshot from https://emulationking.com/gekko/.

gemulator.name: Gemulator 9.0
gemulator.author: Emulators, Inc.
gemulator.description: Gemulator 9.0 is an Atari 800, Atari ST and Apple Macintosh Classic emulator. NOTE: BIOS files ARE required for Atari ST and Apple Macintosh emulation.

genesisplus.name: Genesis Plus
genesisplus.author: Charles MacDonald
genesisplus.description: Genesis Plus is a Sega Genesis and MegaDrive emulator.

genieous.name: Genieous
genieous.author: Attila Grosz
genieous.description: Genieous is an EACA EG2000 Color Genie emulator. The current version only supports the unexpanded Color Genie.

gens.name: Gens
gens.author: Stephane Dallongeville
gens.description: Gens is a Sega Mega Drive/Genesis, Sega Mega CD & Sega 32X emulator. The earliest semi-functional release (only capable of debugging 68000 instructions) dates from 1999. The current version advertises full compatibility with over 90% of all Genesis games.

gens32.name: Gens32 Surreal
gens32.author: Stphane Dallongeville
gens32.description: Gens32 is a Sega Mega Drive, Sega Mega-CD, Sega 32X, Sega Master System and Sega Game Gear emulator for Windows by the Gens32 team, which is based on Gens and adds lots of features.

gensgs.name: Gens/GS
gensgs.author: David Korth
gensgs.description: Gens/GS is a Sega Mega Drive, Sega Mega-CD, Sega 32X, Sega Master System and Sega Game Gear emulator based on the Genesis emulator Gens. Project goals include clean source code, combined features from various forks of Gens, and improved platform portability.

gensplus.name: Gens Plus!
gensplus.author: Rodrigo Cardoso
gensplus.description: Gens Plus! is a Sega Mega Drive, Sega Mega-CD, Sega 32X, Sega Master System and Sega Game Gear emulator based on the Genesis emulator Gens. It has many optimizations and new features, like new software graphics filters, new sound effects, support for cheats files, support for joysticks with axes, Master System/Game Gear emulation and new screen resolutions.

gest.name: GEST
gest.author: TM
gest.description: GEST is an emulator for the Nintendo Game Boy, Game Boy Color and Super Game Boy.

gm2001.name: GM2001
gm2001.author: Hanz Freemurmur
gm2001.description: This is my emulator for GameMaster 2001, it is being a much popular small game unit here in Europe, I am thinking they make it at other places too!  I decide to make this emulator to learn how to do it.

gsport.name: GSPort
gsport.author: GSport Development Team
gsport.description: GSport is an Apple IIGS emulator based on the KEGS cross-platform IIgs emulator by Kent Dickey.

handy.name: Handy
handy.author: K Wilkins
handy.description: Handy is an Atari Lynx emulator. the Lynx BIOS is not required, unless you wish to run Cartridges.

hatari.name: Hatari
hatari.author: The Hatari Team
hatari.description: Hatari is an Atari ST, STE, TT and Falcon Emulator. A BIOS (TOS) File is not required, but will improve emulation.

hdnes.name: HDNes
hdnes.author: mkwong98
hdnes.description: HDNes is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator with the ability to replace the graphics of the game with custom-made graphics packs and it also comes with an editor for creating them.

hhugboy.name: hhugboy
hhugboy.author: Taizou
hhugboy.description: a Game Boy/Game Boy Color emulator for Windows.

higan.name: higan
higan.author: byuu
higan.license: GNU GPLv3 - Special for Commercial Use
higan.description: higan is a multi-system emulator for the following systems: Nintendo Entertainment Systems, Famicom, SNES, Super Famicom, Super Game Boy, BS-X Stellaview, Sufami Turbo, Game Boy, Game Boy Color, Game Boy Advance and the Wonderswan and Wonderswan Color.

hola.name: HoLa!
hola.author: Attila Grosz
hola.description: Hola! is a HomeLab Model 4 emulator. The Emulator and all documentation is in Hungarian.

homelab.name: HomeLAB
homelab.author: Grsz Attila
homelab.description: HomeLAB is an HomeLAB4 emulator for Windows

horizon.name: Horizon
horizon.author: Chris Lam
horizon.description: Horizon emulates the Acorn BBC Micro (Model B) with 32K RAM. B+ and Master models are not supported.

hoxs64.name: Hoxs64
hoxs64.author: David Horrocks
hoxs64.description: Hoxs64 is a cycle-exact emulator of the Commodore 64.

hpsx64.name: HPSX (Highly-Experimental Playstation Emulator)
hpsx64.author: TheGangster
hpsx64.description: HPSX (Highly-Experimental Playstation Simulator) is a Sony Playstation 1 & Playstation 2 emulator. NOTE: 64bit ONLY and PS2 emulator is still in Alpha.

ht1080z.name: HT1080Z
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer
ht1080z.author: Attila Grosz
ht1080z.description: HT-1080Z is a VideoGenie I, System-80, TRS-80 and HT-1080Z emulator.

hu6280.name: Hu6280
hu6280.author: Vobbo
hu6280.description: Hu6280 is an NEC TurboGrafx-16 Entertainment SuperSystem and PC Engine emulator.

hugo.name: Hu-Go!
hugo.author: Zeograd
hugo.description: Good pce emulator. Plays sounds, support fullscreen. Plays most roms!

hyper64.name: Hyper64
hyper64.author: Benjamin 'BeRo' Rosseaux
hyper64.description: Hyper64 is a working proof-of-concept of an experimental C64 emulator implementation without resorting to a conventional CPU emulation, but instead utilizing a realtime dynamic recompilation engine  which disassembles, analyzes and re-assembles the 6510 machine code as native 32-bit x86 code. It further uses a fast translation code cache.

ice64.name: ICE64
ice64.author: Pokefan
ice64.description: ICE64 is a Nintendo 64 emulator base on the NICE64 v2.1.2 code base

ideas.name: iDeaS
ideas.author: Lino and Actarus
ideas.description: iDeaS is a Nintendo DS emulator that can also play Game Boy Advance games.

ines.name: iNES
ines.author: Marat Fayzullin
ines.description: iNES is a Nintendo Entertainment System and Famicom emulator.

infovectrex.name: InfoVectrex
infovectrex.author: Jay's Factory
infovectrex.description: InfoVectrex is a Bandai Vectrex emulator.

ip6.name: iP6
ip6.author: ISHIOKA Hiroshi
ip6.description: iP6 is an NEC PC-6001 emulator.

ip6plus.name: iP6 Plus
ip6plus.author: Windy
ip6plus.description: iP6 Plus is an NEC PC-6001, PC-6001 mk2, PC-6601, PC-6601mk2SR, PC-6601SR, PC-6006SR and PC-6007SR emulator based on the iP6 emulator by Mr Ishioka.

ishiirukadolphin.name: ishiiruka dolphin
ishiirukadolphin.author: Tino
ishiirukadolphin.description: This Version complements Official Dolphin-Master giving support for legacy devices, and reducing cpu usage on the graphic thread. The focus is the gaming experience and speed.

jackal.name: Jackal
jackal.author: Expert and Floating Point
jackal.description: Jackal is a Sony Playstation 1 emulator.

jagulator.name: Jagulator
jagulator.author: SubQMod
jagulator.description: Jagulator is an Atari Jaguar emulator. It runs way to fast to be playable on my Laptop.

javacpc.name: JavaCPC
javacpc.author: Markus Hohmann aka Devilmarkus
javacpc.description: JavaCPC is a Java-based CPC emulator that has a complete Desktop environment.

jnes.name: Jnes
jnes.author: Jabo
jnes.description: Jnes is a NES emulator for Windows platforms. Its emulation capabilities include graphics, sound, controllers, zapper, and many memory mapping boards found in most USA games and a few popular Japanese boards adding international delight. Jnes boasts an intuitive user interface with instant saves and movie recording to making playing NES games more enjoyable. One of the coolest features is the included database of Pro-Action-Replay and Game Genie cheats, courtesy of Gent.

joyce.name: JOYCE
joyce.author: John Elliott
joyce.description: JOYCE emulates a PCW8000 series computer. Run it, and your PC becomes a PCW.

jpcsp.name: JPCSP
jpcsp.author: JCPSP Team
jpcsp.description: JPCSP is a Sony Playstation Portable emulator. NOTE: You may have to amend the '.bat' file to point to the correct location of your Java installation.

jpemu.name: JPeMu IMPACT
jpemu.author: Tony Friery
jpemu.description: JPeMu emulates Fruit Machines based on JPM Impact technology.

jum52.name: Jum52
jum52.author: James
jum52.description: Jum52 is a cross-platform Atari 5200 emulator. It is available in MSDOS, Windows, Playstation 2, PSP, Mac, BeOS and QNX versions.

jvz200.name: James VZ200
jvz200.author: James the Animal Tamer
jvz200.description: James's VZ200, an emulator for the VZ200 computer

jynx.name: Jynx
jynx.author: Jonathan Markland
jynx.description: Jynx is an emulator for the Camputers Lynx computer. See http://jynxemulator.wordpress.com/ for more information.

kat5200.name: kat5200
kat5200.author: Brian Berlin
kat5200.description: kat5200 is an emulator for the Atari 5200 and 8-bit computers.

kc85emu.name: KC85EMU
kc85emu.author: Frank Ludwig
kc85emu.description: KC85EMU is an emulator for the home computer, the number KC85 from the VEB microelectronics "Wilhelm Pieck" Mhlhausen. In addition to the computers KC85 / 3 and / 4, it can also the great-KC HC900 (KC85 / 2) and the fully developed KC85 / 4 emulate with 256k RAM and KC-CAOS 4.5 (KC85 / 5).

kcemu.name: KCemu
kcemu.author: Paul Torsten
kcemu.description: The KC85 connects to the Internet and can access USB storage media. This is made possible by the new module M052. This includes both a network interface and a USB host port.

kegafusion.name: Kega Fusion
kegafusion.author: Steve Snake
kegafusion.description: Fusion is a Sega SG1000, SC3000, Master System, Game Gear, Genesis/Megadrive, SVP, Pico, SegaCD/MegaCD and 32X emulator for Win9x/ME/2000/XP/Vista and Mac OSX/Intel

kegs.name: Kent's Emulated GS
kegs.author: Kent Dickey
kegs.description: KEGS is an Apple IIgs emulator for Mac OS X, Linux, and Win32. The Apple IIgs was the most powerful computer in the Apple II line. It first was sold in 1986.  An Apple IIgs has the capability to run almost all Apple II, Apple IIe, and Apple IIc programs.

kegs32.name: Kent's Emulated GS32
kegs32.author: Chea Chee Keong
kegs32.description: KEGS32 is Apple ][ GS emulator based on the Kent Dickey's KEGS for UNIX.

kigb.name: KiGB
kigb.author: Ricky Liu and Scott Nash
kigb.description: KiGB is a Nintendo Game Boy and Game Boy Color emulator.

kindred.name: Kindred
kindred.author: Kris Bleakley
kindred.description: Kindred is an emulator for the Nintendo Entertainment System, Famicom Disk System, Super Nintendo Entertainment System, Super Famicom and Game Boy and the Sega Master System. It is also designed to aid in the development of software for these systems.

klive.name: Klive
klive.author: Steve Snake
klive.description: Klive is a Sinclair ZX Spectrum emulator.

koleko.name: KOLEKO
koleko.author: Saverio Russo aka SiRioKD
koleko.description: KOLEKO is a Coleco ColecoVision emulator.

koyote.name: Koyote
koyote.author: David Raingeard and Romain Tisserand
koyote.description: Koyote is an SNK Neo Geo Pocket and Pocket Color emulator.

lisa.name: Lisa
lisa.author: Gilles Fetis
lisa.description: Lisa is an Apple Lisa emulator.

lisaem.name: LisaEm
lisaem.author: Ray A. Arachelian
lisaem.description: LisaEm is an Apple Lisa emulator.

luagb.name: LuaGB
luagb.author: Nicholas Flynt
luagb.description: A gameboy emulator written in Pure Lua. Approaching feature completeness, but still a work in progress. This is designed to be fairly cross platform, and currently consists of a platform-independent gameboy module which contains the emulator, and a Love2D interface, presently the only supported platform.

model2emu.name: Sega Model 2
model2emu.author: ElSemi
model2emu.description: Model 2 Emulator is a SEGA Model 2, 2A, 2B and 2C emulator. NOTE: To bypass the 'Network Board Not Present' message you need to set the 'Link ID' to 'Single'. To do this, enter Test Mode ('F2'), then select 'Game System' ('z' moves down, 'c' moves up, '1' selects) and select 'Single' in 'Link ID'. Finally, exit out of Test Mode and everything should work.

m88.name: M88
m88.author: rururutan
m88.description: M88 is an NEC PC8001 emulator. NOTE: The emulator is in Japanese.

mahnes.name: MahNES
mahnes.author: H Lorenzi
mahnes.description: MahNES is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator.

makaron.name: Makaron
makaron.author: Deunan
makaron.description: Makaron is a Sega Dreamcast and Naomi emulator.

makaronex.name: MakaronEX
makaronex.author: MakaronEx team
makaronex.description: This dreamcast emulator is capable of running many commercial games and has a pretty high compatibility rate.

mame.name: M.A.M.E.
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer
mame.author: M.A.M.E. and M.E.S.S. team.
mame.description: MAME (an acronym of Multiple Arcade Machine Emulator) is a free and open source emulator designed to recreate the hardware of arcade game systems in software on modern personal computers and other platforms. The intention is to preserve gaming history by preventing vintage games from being lost or forgotten.

mameclassic.name: M.A.M.E. classic (till v0.161)
mameclassic.author: M.A.M.E. team
mameclassic.description: MAME (an acronym of Multiple Arcade Machine Emulator) is a free and open source emulator designed to recreate the hardware of arcade game systems in software on modern personal computers and other platforms. The intention is to preserve gaming history by preventing vintage games from being lost or forgotten.

mednafen.name: Mednafen
mednafen.author: The Mednafen Team
mednafen.description: Mednafen is a portable, utilizing OpenGL and SDL, argument (command-line)-driven multi-system emulator. Mednafen has the ability to remap hotkey functions and virtual system inputs to a keyboard, a joystick, or both simultaneously. Save states are supported, as is real-time game rewinding. Screen snapshots may be taken, in the PNG file format, at the press of a button. Mednafen can record audiovisual movies in the QuickTime file format, with several different lossless codecs supported. The following systems are supported: Atari Lynx, Neo Geo Pocket (Color), WonderSwan, GameBoy (Color), GameBoy Advance, Nintendo Entertainment System, Super Nintendo Entertainment System/Super Famicom, Virtual Boy, PC Engine/TurboGrafx 16 (CD), SuperGrafx, PC-FX, Sega Game Gear, Sega Genesis/Megadrive, Sega Master System & Sony PlayStation.

medusa.name: Medusa
medusa.author: Jeffrey Pfau
medusa.description: medusa is an emulator for running Nintendo DS, Game Boy Advance and Game Boy games. It aims to be faster and more accurate than many existing Nintendo DS and Game Boy Advance emulators, as well as adding features that other emulators lack. It also supports Game Boy and Game Boy Color games.

mega8.name: Mega8
mega8.author: Ready4Next/Junta
mega8.description: Mega8 is a Chip-8, MegaChip8 and SuperChip emulator. It includes the Revival Studios Chip-8 Compilation pack consisting of heaps of programs, games and demos for the Chip-8, SuperChip and MegaChip8.

meisei.name: meisei
meisei.author: hap
meisei.description: meisei is an MSX emulator. NOTE: BIOS is NOT required but will improve emulation and allow access to extra features.

meka.name: MEKA
meka.author: Omar Cornut
meka.description: MEKA is a multi-system emulator that emulates the following: Sega Game 1000 (SG-1000), Sega Computer 3000 (SC-3000), Sega Super Control Station (SF-7000), Sega Mark III + FM Unit, Sega Master System, Sega Game Gear, Coleco ColecoVision and Othello Multivision.

melonds.name: melonDS
melonds.author: StapleButter
melonds.description: melonDS is part of a second wave of DS emulators. There are a few other emulator projects that are part of it, which you might have already heard of.

mercury.name: Mercury Revival
mercury.author: Avgardisme
mercury.description: Mercury Revival is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator. This emulator is in French.

mesadx.name: MesaDX
mesadx.author: Eric R Quinn
mesadx.description: MesaDX is a Sega Master System and Game Gear emulator.

mesen.name: Mesen
mesen.author: M Bibaud aka Sour
mesen.description: Mesen is a Nintendo Entertainment System and Famicom emulator.

mess.name: M.E.S.S.
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer
mess.author: M.E.S.S. Team
mess.description: Multi Emulator Super System (MESS) is an emulator for many game consoles and computer systems, based on the MAME core and now a part of M.A.M.E v0.162+ (May 2015).

mfme.name: Multiple Fruit Machine
mfme.author: C.J. Wren
mfme.description: MFME supports the following Fruit Machines: BFM Dotmatrix, Electrocoin, Epoch, Impact, M1A, MPS, MPU 3, MPU 4, MPU 5, Proconn, Scorpion 1, Scorpion 2, Scorpion 4, spACE, System 1, System 5, System 80

mgba.name: mGBA
mgba.author: Jeffrey Pfau
mgba.description: mGBA is a Nintendo Game Boy, Game Boy Color and Game Boy Advance emulator.

micro64.name: Micro64
micro64.author: Benjamin 'BeRo' Rosseaux
micro64.description: Micro64 aims to be the most accurate Commodore 64 emulator.

minimon.name: Minimon
minimon.author: Bryon Vandiver
minimon.description: This is the world first Pokemon Mini emulator.

minivmac.name: Mini vMac
minivmac.author: Paul C Pratt and Others
minivmac.description: Mini vMac is an Apple Macintosh (using Motorola 680x0 processors) emulator.

minus4.name: Minus4w
minus4.author: Mike Dailly
minus4.description: Minus / 4 is a C16 / Plus/4 emulator for Windows.

modelb.name: model-b
modelb.author: Tom Seddon
modelb.description: model-b is an Acorn BBC emulator. NOTE: Screenshot from Author's Website.

modeler.name: Modeler
modeler.author: Farftch'd, R Belmont and Sarayan
modeler.description: Modeler is a Sega System 32 and Model 1 emulator. Supported playable games in this release are: Golden Axe 2 (1992, System 32 hardware), Spiderman (1991, System 32 hardware), Arabian Fight (1992, System 32 hardware), Sonic the Hedgehog (prototype) (1994, System 32 hardware), Holosseum (1992, System 32 hardware), Outrunners (1993, Multi32 hardware), Arabian Fight (1992, System 32 hardware), Burning Rival (1992, System 32 hardware), Super Visual Football (1994, System 32 hardware), Alien3: The Gun (1993, System 32 hardware), Rad Mobile (1990, System 32 hardware), Hard Dunk (1992, Multi32 hardware), Title Fight (1992, Multi32 hardware). Supported watchable games are: Rad Rally (1991, System 32 hardware), F1 Exhaust Note (1992, System 32 hardware), F1 Super Lap (1992, System 32 hardware), Virtua Racing (1993, Model 1 hardware), Virtua Fighter (1993, Model 1 hardware), Star Wars Arcade (1994, Model 1 hardware). "Watchable" games run but have one or more graphical, audio, or control flaws that prevent them from being playable in our opinion.

mtxemu.name: Mt. Xemu
mtxemu.author: Per Persson and Bemmu Sepponen
mtxemu.description: Mt. Xemu is a Memotech MTX emulator.

mupen64plusplus.name: Mupen64++
mupen64plusplus.author: Okaygo
mupen64plusplus.description: Mupen64++ (aka Mupen64k) is the emulator for online play woring with the most games. The emulator has support for peer-to-peer online play with Kaillera. Mupen64++ always uses the game save data from the host, and synchronizes it with everyone else playing.

mynes.name: My NES
mynes.author: Ala Ibrahim Hadid
mynes.description: My NES is a portable, open source, low level Nintendo Entertainment Systema and Famicom emulator.

mz800emu.name: MZ-800
mz800emu.author: Michael Hucik aka chaky
mz800emu.description: MZ800Emu is a Sharp MZ-700 and MZ-800 emulator.

mzxx.name: MZXX
mzxx.author: Michael Franzen
mzxx.description: MZXX is an multi-system emulator for the following: Sharp MZ-80K, MZ-80A, MZ-80B, MZ-700, MZ-800, MZ-1500, Sinclair ZX81, ZX Spectrum (multiple versions), Timex TK95, Coleco ColecoVision and the Jupiter Cantab Jupiter Ace. It also emulates over 100 Arcade Machines.

nanowasp.name: NanoWasp
nanowasp.author: Dave Chuchill
nanowasp.description: An emulator for the Microbee, a microcomputer popular in Australia in the early '80s.

ncdz.name: NEOGEO CD Emulator-Z
ncdz.author: NJ
ncdz.description: NEOGEO CD emulator-Z is a SNK Neo Geo CD emulator. NOTE: You must have the original games or a perfect (1:1) image (.iso, .mp3 etc. will NOT work). This is due to the emulator having an internal database of games and it blocks anything that doesn't match.

nebula.name: Nebula
nebula.author: ElSemi
nebula.description: Nebula is a Capcom CPS1 and CPS2 and SNK NeoGeo emulator.

nekoprojectii.name: Neko Project II
nekoprojectii.author: NP Team
nekoprojectii.description: Neko Project II is an NEC PC-9801 series emulator.

nemu64.name: Nemu64
nemu64.author: Lemmy, LaC, hWnd
nemu64.description: Nemu64 is one of the oldest Nintendo 64 emulators in existance. For a long time it was also nearly unplayable due to being to slow for most PCs to run. Fortunately as both Nemu64 and the development of faster multi-Ghz CPU's progressed, Nemu64 can be played without much slowdown.

nemulator.name: Nemulator
nemulator.author: James Slepicka
nemulator.description: nemulator is a Nintendo Entertainment Systems and Sega Master System emulator.

neocdsdl.name: NeoCD/SDL
neocdsdl.author: Fosters
neocdsdl.description: NeoCD/SDL is a port of NeoCD using SDL libraries.

neochip8.name: NeoChip8
neochip8.author: Eric Scrivner aka zenogais
neochip8.description: NeoChip8 is a RCA COSMAC VIP and Chip-8 emulator.

neonds.name: NeonDS
neonds.author: release, jitc, notrace
neonds.description: The NeonDS is an emulator of Nintendos latest handheld console, the Nintendo DS and DSi XL. It works on the Windows Operating System (OS) with an independent interface. The makers have recently released the latest version, V 0.2.1; and so far, Nintendo DS on PC fans are pleased with the remarkable graphics and improving sounds. NeonDS does not require a high end PC for functioning well. Pentium 4 processor, 512 GB to 1 GB RAM and 128 MB video support are enough to run the program at normal playable speeds. It works on Windows XP, Vista and Windows 7 OS.  Since the first public version (V 0.0.2) was released in 2008, the emulator has exhibited remarkable optimization. Even if the computer does not have a Dual-Core processor, the emulator can run at an impressive 50 to 60 frames per second (FPS). It even has an exploit system called the OpenGL 2.0. This allows the user to take screen shots of the game! Development of the software took a giant leap in Version 0.2.0. Here, the makers have finally completed its new 3 dimensional display engine, which enables crisper graphics and the video capturing feature. Many full 3D games became playable, and many bugs were fixed. The NDS firmware settings were also updated. As for the tactile input on the DS touch-screen, later versions of the NeonDS have been equipped a virtual interface. The window of the program has two screens, like the real NDS. The touch screen works by pressing and dragging with the mouse pointer. The basic directional controls, A-B buttons etc, are operated by the keyboard. The corresponding keyboards buttons are fully customizable.

neopocott.name: NeoPocott
neopocott.author: Julien FRELAT "Gollum"
neopocott.description: NeoPocott is an SNK Neo Geo Pocket and Neo Geo Pocket Color emulator.

neopop.name: NeoPop
neopop.author: neopop_uk
neopop.description: NeoPop is a portable 'NeoGeo Pocket (Color)' emulator.

nesemu.name: nes-emu
nesemu.author: Antonio Maiorano
nesemu.description: nes-emu is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator.

nesterj.name: nesterJ
nesterj.author: Screw, Mikami Kana
nesterj.description: nesterJ is a Nintendo Entertainment System and Famicom emulator based on 'nester public beta 3' by Darren Ranalli.

nesticle.name: NESticle
nesticle.author: Bloodlust Software
nesticle.description: NESticle is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator.

nestopia.name: Nestopia
nestopia.author: Martin Freij
nestopia.description: Nestopia is an open source NES/Famicom emulator written in standard C++, focused on delivering as accurate emulation as possible. It is released under the GNU General Public License (GPL)

neusnem.name: NewSneM
neusnem.author: Tom Walker
neusnem.description: NewSneM is a Nintendo SNES emulator.

neutrinosx2.name: neutrinoSX2
neutrinosx2.author: Muad and nSX2 Team
neutrinosx2.description: neutrinoSX2 is a Sony Playstation 2 emulator.

ngae.name: NGAE
ngae.author: IsmaMj
ngae.description: NGAE is a Neo Geo emulator based on MAME 146.

nintendulator.name: Nintendulator
nintendulator.author: Quietust
nintendulator.description: Nintendulator is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator.

nlmsx.name: NLMSX
nlmsx.author: Frits Hilderink
nlmsx.description: NLMSX is an emulator for the MSX, MSX2, MSX2+ and MSX Turbo-R computers.

nnnesterj.name: NNNesterJ
nnnesterj.author: UNKNOWN
nnnesterj.description: NNNesterJ is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator based on NesterJ.

noc64.name: no$c64
noc64.author: Martin Korth
noc64.description: nocash C64 emulator - Emulates cpu, memory, video, keyboard, joysticks, timers. Supports single file cassette loading (.PRG or .P00 files). Local keyboard support. Fast boot and fast intro/memcopy mechanisms. Fully featured debugger with breakpoints, symbolic debug info (labels), automatic I/O and Kernal disassembler comments, vram viewer, built-in assembler/disassembler supports native/nocash syntaxes, upload to real C64 function, help includes built-in C64 programming specs.

nocpc.name: no$cpc
nocpc.author: Martin Korth
nocpc.description: nocash Amstrad/Schneider CPC Emulator/Debugger for DOS/Windows.

nogba.name: no$gba
nogba.author: Martin Korth
nogba.description: nocash Gameboy Advance / Nintendo DS / DSi emulator/debugger for windows. Note that this version also includes an emulator for the Sony PocketStation.

nogmb.name: no$gmb
nogmb.author: Martin Korth
nogmb.description: No$gmb is a emulator for gameboy, pocket gameboy, super gameboy, and color gameboy, like the other no$-emulators it's including a comfortable debugger, so that it's more a serious development tool than just a emulator.

nomsx.name: no$msx
nomsx.author: Martin Korth
nomsx.description: No$msx is a MSX1 + MSX2 emulator for DOS and Windows, like the other no$-emulators it's including a comfortable debugger, so that it's more a serious development tool than just a emulator. Beside for the development part, the most important goals are: User-friendly GUI and lots of options, and the complete lack of overload - the program is written in raw assembler language, sized about 150 KBytes, and works fine on 33MHz computers.

nosns.name: no$sns
nosns.author: Martin Korth
nosns.description: nocash SNES/Super Famicom emulator/debugger for windows.

nozx.name: no$zx
nozx.author: Martin Korth
nozx.description: nocash ZX81 & ZX Spectrum emulator/debugger for windows.

nucleus.name: Nucleus
nucleus.author: Alexandro Sanchez Bach
nucleus.description: Nucleus is a Sony Playstation 3 emulator. NOTE: This emulator requires PS3 firmware keys to be placed in a file named 'keys.xml' next to the executable.

nulldc.name: nullDC
nulldc.author: Stefanos Kornilios Mitsis Poiitidis
nulldc.description: nullDC is a Sega Dreamcast emulator.

nulldcn.name: nullDC NAOMI
nulldcn.author: Stefanos Kornilios Mitsis Poiitidis
nulldcn.description: NullDC Naomi is a Sega Naomi emulator.

o2em.name: O2EM
o2em.author: Daniel Boris
o2em.description: O2EM is a Philips Videopac G700, Videopac+ G7400 and Magnavox Odyssey 2 emulator.

oricutron.name: Oricutron
oricutron.author: Peter Gordon
oricutron.description: Oricutron is an Oric Atmos, Oric-1, Telestrat and Pravetz 8D emulator.

osmose.name: Osmose
osmose.author: Bruno Vedder
osmose.description: Osmose is a Sega Master System and Game Gear emulator.

oswan.name: Oswan
oswan.author: Cal2
oswan.description: Oswan is a Bandai WonderSwan and WonderSwan Color emulator.

oswanu.name: Oswan (Unofficial)
oswanu.author: Kazz
oswanu.description: Oswan (Unofficial) is a Bandai WonderSwan and WonderSwan Color emulator. This is an unofficial build based on Oswan by Cal2.

pale.name: Pete's Amazing Lynx
pale.author: Pete Todd
pale.description: The Camputers Lynx was a unique computer.

parajve.name: Parabellum's Java Vectrex
parajve.author: Franck Chevassu
parajve.description: Parabellum's Java Vectrex Emulator is a GCE Vectrex emulator. This emulator comes with a large collection of included ROMs.

pasofami.name: Pasofami
pasofami.author: N. Andou
pasofami.description: Pasofami is a Nintendo Entertainment / Nintendo Famicom emulator and debugger for Windows. Originally making it's debut in 1995 Pasofami was one of the first Famicom emulators to come out of Japan and over time has developed a rich feature set.

pc6001v.name: PC6001V
pc6001v.author: Yumitaro
pc6001v.description: PC6001V is an NEC PC-6000 series emulator. NOTE: Website is in Japanese.

pc6001vw.name: PC6001VW
pc6001vw.author: Bernie Mask
pc6001vw.description: PC6001VW is an NEC PC-6000 series emulator based on PC6001V by Yumitaro. NOTE: Emulator appears to be in both English and Japanese. Website is in Japanese.

pc6001vx.name: PC6001VX
pc6001vx.author: eighttails
pc6001vx.description: PC6001VX is an NEC PC-6000 series emulator based on PC6001V by Yumitaro. NOTE: Website is in Japanese.

pc64.name: Personal C64
pc64.author: Wolfgang Lorenz
pc64.description: Runs 50% of the C64 games, has sound, supports fastloaders, contains database with 4000 games. Recommended system is a Pentium-100 with 256 KB PB-Cache and a PCI graphics card with hardware scaling and a DirectDraw driver.

pc88win.name: PC88Win
pc88win.author: SOLTIN software
pc88win.description: a NEC - PC8801 Emulator on the Windows platform.

pcae.name: PC Atari
pcae.author: John Dullea
pcae.description: PC Atari Emulator bridges the gap between the technology of today and the memories of yesteryear.

pcejin.name: PCEjin
pcejin.author: Paul_t
pcejin.description: PCEjin is an NEC TurboGrafx-16 Entertainment SuperSystem and PC Engine emulator.

pcemacplus.name: PCE-MacPlus
pcemacplus.author: Hampa Hug
pcemacplus.description: PCE-MacPlus is an Apple Macintosh Plus emulator.

pcsp.name: PCSP
pcsp.author: PCSP Team
pcsp.description: PCSP is a Sony Playstation Portable emulator.

pcsx.name: PCSX
pcsx.author: PCSX Team
pcsx.description: Pcsx is a Sony Playstation 1 emulator. A BIOS is NOT required but may make some games run better! Also, this emulator requires Plugins.

pcsx2.name: PCSX2
pcsx2.author: PCSX2 team
pcsx2.description: PCSX2 is an open-source PlayStation 2 (AKA PS2) emulator. Its purpose is to emulate the PS2 hardware, using a combination of MIPS CPU Interpreters, Recompilers and a Virtual Machine which manages hardware states and PS2 system memory. This allows you to play PS2 games on your PC, with many additional features and benefits.

pcsxr.name: PCSX-Reloaded
pcsxr.author: PCSX-Reloaded Team
pcsxr.description: PCSX-Reloaded is a Sony Playstation 1 emulator based on Pcsx. A BIOS is NOT required but may make some games run better! Also, this emulator requires Plugins.

pcsxrr.name: PCSX-RR
pcsxrr.author: PCSX-Reloaded Team
pcsxrr.description: PCSX-RR is a Sony Playstation 1 emulator based on Pcsx. A BIOS is NOT required but may make some games run better! Also, this emulator requires Plugins.

pearpc.name: PearPC
pearpc.author: Sebastian Biallas and Others
pearpc.description: PearPC (PowerPC Architecture Emulator) is an PowerPC emulator. NOTE: PearPC requires a client OS (such as Darwin for PowerPC, Mac OS X or Mandrake Linux 9.1 for PowerPC) that runs in the emulator.

phoenix.name: Phoenix
phoenix.author: Grishin Maxim Leonidovich aka Altmer
phoenix.license: Free for Personal and Non-Commercial Use
phoenix.description: Phoenix is a Russian multi-system emulator for the Panasonic 3DO, Coleco Colecovision, Sega Game Gear, Sega SG-1000 and Sega Master System. NOTE: The entire emulator is in Russian.

picodrive.name: PicoDrive
picodrive.author: notaz
picodrive.description: Picodrive is a Sega 32X, Sega Megadrive / Genesis, Sega Master System & Sega MegaCD emulator, originally coded for handheld devices.

pk201.name: PK201
pk201.author: Dr. Hell
pk201.description: PK201 is a Sony PocketStation emulator.

pkemu.name: PKEmu
pkemu.author: SN systems
pkemu.description: PKEmu is a Sony Pocket Station emulator.

plus4emu.name: plus4emu
plus4emu.author: Istvan Varga
plus4emu.description: plus4emu is an open source, portable emulator of the Commodore 264 family of computers (C16, C116, and Plus/4), written in C++, and supporting Windows and POSIX platforms (32 bit Windows, 32 and 64 bit Linux, and MacOS X have been tested). It implements accurate, high quality hardware emulation, however, the system requirements are higher than that of most other emulators

pmd85.name: PMD85
pmd85.author: Martin Schotek
pmd85.description: PMD85 is an emulator for the Tesla Piestany and Bratislava PMD85 computers and their clones. NOTE: Emulator and Website are in Czechoslovakian.

pokemini.name: Poke Mini
pokemini.author: JustBurn
pokemini.description: Poke Mini is a Nintendo Pokemon-Mini emulator.

pom1.name: Pom1
pom1.author: John D Corrado and Verhille Arnaud
pom1.description: Pom1 is an Apple 1 emulator. It uses SDL and works on most platforms.

potator.name: Potator
potator.author: David Raingeard
potator.description: This appears to be the first Watara Supervision emulator for Windows. It uses the SDL library and has good compatibility.

potemkin.name: Potemkin
potemkin.author: Henrik Rydgard (aka ector)
potemkin.description: Potemkin (Codename DaSH) is an experimental HLE Sony Playstation Portable emulator.

ppsspp.name: PPSSPP
ppsspp.author: Henrik Rydgard
ppsspp.description: PPSSPP is a Sony Playstation Portable emulator.

project64.name: Project64
project64.author: Zilmar and Jabo
project64.description: Project64 is a Nintendo 64 emulator which at first seemed to have popped up out of nowhere, offering excelent game support with little bugs. Future versions only improved things more!

project64k.name: Project64k
project64k.author: Smasherx74
project64k.description: Project64k is a modified version of the Nintendo 64 emulator, Project64 1.4. It was originally created by Hotquik and is currently developed by Smasherx74. As a Nintendo 64 emulator, the program has the ability to run Super Smash Bros., as well as a majority of the Nintendo 64's library. Unless the user has an N64 controller adapter for PC, they will generally be using a keyboard to play. (Core 2.2 releases: https://github.com/Ownasaurus/Project64k-Core-2.2/releases)

project64k7e.name: Project64K7E
project64k7e.author: Gaudy
project64k7e.description: Project64K7E is a Nintendo 64 emulator based on Project64.

projecttempest.name: Project Tempest
projecttempest.author: Ville Linde
projecttempest.description: It runs in Windows 9x/2000/XP and currently emulates many commercial games, some even with sound. However, you need a quite fast computer to run it at full speed.

prosystem.name: ProSystem
prosystem.author: Greg Stanton
prosystem.description: ProSystem is an emulator for the Windows operating system that will allow you to play Atari 7800 video games on your PC. An emulator is a program that has the ability to imitate another program, device, or computer. The ProSystem emulator imitates the Atari 7800's CPU, video, audio, joystick controls, etc. Before you can use the emulator, you will need to obtain rom images that are compatible with the Atari 7800.

ps2emu.name: PS2EMU
ps2emu.author: Roor Makurosu, Scar_T and Shunt
ps2emu.description: PS2EMU is a Sony Playstation 2 emulator.

psinex.name: PSinex
psinex.author: pSyChOjAk and Shunt
psinex.description: PSinex PC Emulator is a Sony Playstation 1 emulator. A BIOS is NOT required but may make some games run better! Also, this emulator requires Plugins.

pspe.name: pspe
pspe.author: Unknown
pspe.description: Emulation is growing every day, and PSPE is a perfect prove of that, even though this emulator still can't run any commercial PSP game, you can try it by playing some demos and homebrew games.

psx.name: pSX
psx.author: Unknown
psx.description: This emulator fully emulates the Sony Playstation. Compatibility is fairly high, most games I've tried work well.

psxeven.name: PSXeven
psxeven.author: Xeven
psxeven.description: PSXeven is a Sony Playstation 1 emulator. This emulator is released with default Plugins, but can be extended further with other PSX Plugins.

psxjin.name: PSXjin
psxjin.author: The PSXjin Team
psxjin.description: PSXjin is a Sony Playstation 1 emulator.

psyke.name: PSyKe
psyke.author: Giovanni Bajo and Stefano Crosara
psyke.description: PSyKe is a Sony Playstation 1 emulator. This emulator requires the CD-ROM to be placed in the CD Drive.

punes.name: puNES
punes.author: FHorse
punes.description: puNES is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator.

ql2k.name: QL2K
ql2k.author: Jimmy Montesinos
ql2k.description: meisei is an MSX emulator. NOTE: BIOS is NOT required but will improve emulation and allow access to extra features.

qlay2.name: QLAY2
qlay2.author: Jimmy Montesinos and Raphael Zhou
qlay2.description: QLAY2 is a Sinclair QL emulator. It is a port of QLAY.

qlayw.name: QLAY
qlayw.author: Jan Venema
qlayw.description: QLAY is a Sinclair QL emulator.

quasi88.name: QUASI88
quasi88.author: S. Fukunaga
quasi88.description: Portable PC-8801 emulator for Unix/X11, Mac OS X, and Windows.

race.name: RACE!
race.author: Judge_
race.description: ACE! is a NGPC emulator originally envisioned for the GP2X.  It is currently available in binary form for GP2X, PC, and GP32.  It should be easily portable to other systems like PSP, Zodiac, DreamCast, etc.

radio86.name: RADIO-86
radio86.author: Alexander Demin
radio86.description: RADIO-86 is a Radio 86RK emulator. This emulator comes with several games.

rainbow.name: Rainbow
rainbow.author: Chris Lam
rainbow.description: Rainbow emulates the Atari 8-bit series of home computers including the 400/800, 800XL,130XE and the 5200 games console.

rascalboyadv.name: RascalBoy Advance
rascalboyadv.author: Lino Maglione
rascalboyadv.description: RascalBoy Advance is a Nintendo Game Boy Advance emulator.

real80pro.name: Real-80 PRO
real80pro.author: Kollar Zoltan
real80pro.description: Real-80 PRO is a EACA Video Genie-1 and HT1080Z emulator.

realityboy.name: Reality Boy
realityboy.author: David Tucker
realityboy.description: Reality Boy is a Nintendo Virtual Boy emulator.

reddragon.name: Red Dragon
reddragon.author: frostgiant and Parasyte
reddragon.description: Red Dragon is a Nintendo Virtual Boy emulator.

redmsx.name: RedMSX
redmsx.author: SLotman
redmsx.description: RedMSX is an MSX, MSX2 and MSX2+ emulator.

redsquirrel.name: Red Squirrel
redsquirrel.author: Graeme Barnes
redsquirrel.description: This is another Acorn Archimedes emulator for Windows. You will need to obtain copies of the RISC OS 3.1 roms before you can use Red Squirrel.

regen.name: Regen
regen.author: AamirM
regen.description: Regen is an emulator which can emulate the following systems with very high accuracy: Sega Genesis/MegaDrive, Sega Master System, GameGear, SG-1000 & SC-3000. It also contains many other useful features and stuff including debuggers.

retrocopy.name: RetroCopy
retrocopy.author: Unknown
retrocopy.description: RetroCopy emulates home consoles and arcade systems so that you can play the games made for those different machines on your PC. RetroCopy simulates hardware extremely accurately which ensures that these classic games are represented exactly like they were on the real systems.

roc.name: Return of CoCo
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer
roc.author: Russ Le Blang
roc.description: ROC (Return of CoCo) is a Tandy/Radio Shack TRS-80, Color Computer I, II, 3, TDP-100 (Tandy Data Products), Dragon Data Dragon 32/64 and Micro-SEP 1600 emulator.

rocknes.name: RockNES
rocknes.author: Zepper
rocknes.description: RockNES is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator and '.nsf' player.

rocknesx.name: RockNES X
rocknesx.author: Alexandre da Veiga
rocknesx.description: RockNES X is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator based on an old version of RockNES by Fx3.

roland.name: Roland
roland.author: Raldus
roland.description: Roland is an emulator of the homecomputers Amstrad/Schneider from the series CPC 464/664/6128 for Linux und Windows. Roland depends on SDL > 1.2 and SDL-Image.

rpcemu.name: RPCemu
rpcemu.author: Tom Walker
rpcemu.description: RPCEmu allows you to emulate classic Acorn systems, such as the Risc PC and A7000, on multiple platforms including Windows, Linux and Mac OS X

rpcs3.name: RPCS3
rpcs3.author: The RPCS3 Team
rpcs3.description: RPCS3 is a Sony Playstation 3 emulator. Screenshot from Author's Website.

rxnes.name: RxNES
rxnes.author: Myles Johnston
rxnes.description: RxNES is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator that attempts to upgrade the graphics of the NES to modern levels.

satourne.name: Satourne
satourne.author: Fabien Autrel
satourne.description: Satourne is a Sega Saturn emulator that can play commercial games.

saturnin.name: Saturnin
saturnin.author: Runik
saturnin.description: Saturnin is an emulator for the Sega Saturn system and Sega Titan Video, developed by Runik. It is programmed in Visual C++ 6.0 for the coding, OpenGL for the display video and Lex/Flex for the reading of the Saturn files.

scummvm.name: ScummVM
scummvm.author: ScummVM Team
scummvm.description: ScummVM is a program which allows you to run certain classic graphical point-and-click adventure games, provided you already have their data files. The clever part about this: ScummVM just replaces the executables shipped with the games, allowing you to play them on systems for which they were never designed!

sdltrs.name: sdltrs
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer
sdltrs.author: Mark Grebe
sdltrs.description: sdltrs is a Tandy/Radio Shack TRS80 series emulator.

platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer

platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer
