platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer

sdl2trs bootable diskette.name: sdl2trs Bootable Diskette
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer

sdl2trs cmd file.name: sdl2trs CMD File
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer

sdl2trs dos diskette.name: sdl2trs DOS Diskette
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer

sharp80.name: Sharp 80
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer
sharp80.author: Matthew Hamilton
sharp80.description: This is a full-featured emulator of a TRS-80 Model III microcomputer. It is free of charge and all source code is publically available.

sharpchip8.name: SharpChip-8
sharpchip8.author: Yannick Comte aka Demonixis
sharpchip8.description: SharpChip-8 is an interpreted language emulator chip-8. It is still experimental emulator, so keep in mind some functionality is not implemented yet.

sheepshaver.name: Sheep Shaver
sheepshaver.author: Christian Bauer aka cebix
sheepshaver.description: SheepShaver is a MacOS run-time environment that runs MacOS 7.5.2 thru 9.0.4.

shortwaves.name: Short Waves
shortwaves.author: InoriRus
shortwaves.description: Short Waves is a Sony Playstation 3 emulator. NOTE: This emulator does not have a GUI, instead the path to the emulated '.elf' and all relevant settings must be specified in the configuration file 'sw_emu.ini', which must be located in a folder with the emulator.

simcoupe.name: SimCoupe
simcoupe.author: Simon Owen
simcoupe.description: SimCoupe is a Miles Gordon Technology SAM Coupe emulator.

simh.name: SIMH
simh.author: Bob Supnik and Others
simh.description: SIMH is a multi-system emulator for the following systems: Data General Nova, Eclipse : Digital Equipment Corporation PDP-1, PDP-4, PDP-7, PDP-8, PDP-9, PDP-10, PDP-11, PDP-15, VAX : GRI Corporation GRI-909, GRI-99 : IBM 1401, 1620, 1130, 7090/7094, System 3 : Interdata (Perkin-Elmer) 16b and 32b systems : Hewlett-Packard 2114, 2115, 2116, 2100, 21MX, 1000 : Honeywell H316/H516 : MITS Altair 8800, with both 8080 and Z80 : Royal-Mcbee LGP-30, LGP-21 : Scientific Data Systems SDS 940 : SWTP 6800.

sneese.name: SNEeSe
sneese.author: Charles Bilyue
sneese.description: SNEeSe is an emulator for the Nintendo SNES console for x86 PCs. SNEeSe is written in 32-bit C, C++, and NASM x86 assembly. Project goal is to make as accurate, functional, and usable an emulation core as is reasonably possible.

snem.name: SneM
snem.author: Tom Walker
snem.description: SneM is a Nintendo SNES emulator.

snes9x.name: SNES9X
snes9x.author: Gary Henderson
snes9x.description: Snes9x is a portable, freeware Super Nintendo Entertainment System (SNES) emulator. It basically allows you to play most games designed for the SNES and Super Famicom Nintendo game systems.

snes9xrr.name: SNES9X Rerecording
snes9xrr.author: UNKNOWN
snes9xrr.description: Snes9x rerecording is a Nintendo SNES and Super Famicom emulator based on Snes9x.

snes9xsx2.name: SNES9X-SX2
snes9xsx2.author: LuigiBlood
snes9xsx2.description: snes9x-sx2 is a Nintendo SNES and Super Famicom emulator based on snes9x

snesgt.name: SNESGT
snesgt.author: GIGO and Hii
snesgt.description: SNESGT is a Nintendo SNES and Super Famicom emulator.

softvms.name: SoftVMS
softvms.author: Marcus Comstedt
softvms.description: SoftVMS is an emulator for the Sega Dreamcast Visual Memory System capable of running some VMS games. Compiled by Atani Software in association with EmuCult.

sorcerer.name: Sorcerer
sorcerer.author: James the Animal Tamer
sorcerer.description: Windows Sorcerer, an emulator for the Exidy Sorcerer.

speccy.name: Speccy
speccy.author: Marat Fayzullin
speccy.description: Speccy is a Sinclair ZX Spectrum, Timex Sinclair, Sam Coupe, Didaktik Gama, Scorpion 256kb and Pentagon 256kb emulator.

spud.name: Spud
spud.author: Richard Chandler
spud.description: Spud is a ZX Spectrum 48k/128k Emulator written in C++, it emulates 16K/48K/128K/+2/+2A/+3 machines.

spudace.name: SpudACE
spudace.author: Richard Chandler
spudace.description: SpudACE is a Jupiter Cantab Jupiter Ace emulator.

ssf.name: SSF
ssf.author: Shima
ssf.description: SSF is a Windows-based emulator of the Sega Saturn and Sega Titan Video (ST-V, an arcade board very similar to the Saturn). Despite the historical difficulty of emulating the Saturn's rather idiosyncratic and complex architecture, and the fact that SSF is developed by a sole developer (Shima), it has overtaken other Saturn emulators to the point of being able to run the majority of games with few to no issues. It is designed to run game CDs directly, so images must be mounted with a virtual drive program (e.g. Daemon Tools) in order to be played.

steem.name: Steem
steem.author: Anthony and Russel Hayward
steem.description: Steem is an open source Atari STE emulator for Windows and Linux. It runs almost every ST program ever made without any problems. Steem is designed to be easy to use and has many unique features. Whether you want to run great old games, use MIDI apps just like you did on the ST or you have some other, more sinister motive, Steem is the emulator for you!

steemsse.name: Steem SSE (Steven Seagal Edition)
steemsse.author: Anthony and Russel Hayward
steemsse.description: Steem SSE (Steven Seagal Edition) is an Atari-ST emulator based on Steem.

stella.name: Stella
stella.author: Bradford Mott & Stephen Anthony
stella.description: Stella is a multi-platform Atari 2600 VCS emulator released under the GNU General Public License (GPL). Stella was originally developed for Linux by Bradford W. Mott, and is currently maintained by Stephen Anthony. Since its original release several people have joined the development team to port Stella to other operating systems such as AcornOS, AmigaOS, DOS, FreeBSD, IRIX, Linux, OS/2, MacOS, Unix, and Windows. The development team is working hard to perfect the emulator and we hope you enjoy our effort.

stem.name: STEM
stem.author: Paul Robson
stem.description: RCA Studio 2 emulator written in C and assembler.

sugarbox.name: Sugarbox
sugarbox.author: Thomas Guillemin
sugarbox.description: Sugarbox is an Amstrad CPC emulator.

supergcube.name: SuperGCube
supergcube.author: spartan11-7
supergcube.description: SuperGCube is a Nintendo Gamecube emulator.

supermodel.name: Supermodel
supermodel.author: Bart Trzynadlowski
supermodel.description: Supermodel is a Sega Model 3 emulator. There are a few games that are playable, but most have some sort of graphics issues.

swfopener.name: SWF Opener
swfopener.author: UnH Solutions
swfopener.description: SWF Opener requires macromedia flash player (flash.ocx)

t2k.name: Jaguar Tempest 2000
t2k.author: Dave Oldcorn aka Dio
t2k.description: Jaguar Tempest 2000 Emulator is an Atari Jaguar emulator that has been specifically coded to run 'Tempest 2000' though it does run a few other Jaguar games.

takeda.name: Takeda Archive
takeda.author: Various
takeda.description: This emulator collection by Toshiya Takeda contains multiple executables for many different systems. It is known as the Common Source Code Project.

tgbdual.name: TGB Dual
tgbdual.author: Gigo and Hii
tgbdual.description: TGB Dual is a Game Boy / Game Boy Color emulator that supports loading two different roms at the same time. When you have have two roms loaded they are linked with an emulated link cable. This means you can trade Pokemon between two different games, for example between Red and Blue. Two people can play two different GameBoy games on one PC at the same time, using a keyboard. IT's also possible to link TGB Dual running on two different PC's on the same network, or over the internet if using a VPN.

ti994w.name: Ti994W
ti994w.author: Frederik G Kaal
ti994w.description: Ti994W is a Texas Instruments TI99/4A emulator.

tilem.name: TilEm
tilem.author: Benjamin Moody and Thibault Duponchelle
tilem.description: TilEm is an emulator and debugger for Texas Instruments Z80-based graphing calculators.

tronds.name: TronDS
tronds.author: jocopoco
tronds.description: TronDS is a Nintendo 3DS emulator released on May 11, 2014 for Windows.

trs80gp.name: trs80gp
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer
trs80gp.author: George Phillips
trs80gp.description: trs80gp is a Tandy/Radio Shack TRS-80 series emulator.

tunix2001.name: Tunix 2001
tunix2001.author: Gavin Turner
tunix2001.description: Tunix 2001 is an Emerson Arcadia 2001, Interton VC4000, VTech Laser 200, Dick Smith VZ-200 and Sinclair Spectrum 48k emulator.

turboengine.name: Turbo Engine 16
turboengine.author: AamirM
turboengine.description: Turbo Engine 16 is an NEC TurboGrafx-16 Entertainment SuperSystem, PC Engine, SuperGrafx, PC Engine 2, CDROM and Super CDROM emulator.

twombit.name: TwoMBit
twombit.author: piciji
twombit.description: TwoMBit is an Sega Master System, Game Gear and SG-1000 emulator.

ubee512.name: uBee512
ubee512.author: Stewart Kay
ubee512.description: uBee512 is an emulator for the Microbee Z80 ROM, FDD and HDD based models.

ubernes.name: UberNES
ubernes.author: M \ K Productions
ubernes.description: UberNES is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator.

ultimo.name: Ultimo
ultimo.author: Attila Grosz
ultimo.description: Ultimo is a Microkey Primo emulator. NOTE: Emulator is in Hungarian.

ultrahle.name: UltraHLE
ultrahle.author: Epsilon and RealityMan
ultrahle.description: UltraHLE is an emulator allowing games for the Nintendo 64 game console to be run on a computer. It was hailed as a massive step forward in emulation technology upon its release in 1999. Emulating the N64 (which at the time was only 3 years old), it was the first of the N64 emulators to run commercial titles at a playable frame rate on the hardware of the time. Also notable for its time, UltraHLE was capable of playing commercial games while the console was still commercially viable. Concerned about potential piracy, Nintendo threatened the authors and the site hosting UltraHLE, EmuUnlim, with legal action. Despite this, UltraHLE had grown beyond either its authors\ or Nintendo\s control. Subsequently Epsilon and RealityMan abandoned their pseudonyms and went into hiding.

ultrahle2064.name: UltraHLE 2064
ultrahle2064.author: The UltraHLE 2064 team
ultrahle2064.description: UltraHLE is an emulator allowing games for the Nintendo 64 game console to be run on a computer. It was hailed as a massive step forward in emulation technology upon its release in 1999. Emulating the N64 (which at the time was only 3 years old), it was the first of the N64 emulators to run commercial titles at a playable frame rate on the hardware of the time. Also notable for its time, UltraHLE was capable of playing commercial games while the console was still commercially viable.

unrealspeccy.name: UnrealSpeccy
unrealspeccy.author: deathsoft
unrealspeccy.description: UnrealSpeccy is a ZX Spectrum and Russian Clones emulator. The original emulator was coded by SMT and then by Alone Coder Coder before deathsoft took over. NOTE: Forum is in Russian.

unz.name: UNZ
unz.author: Kasanova
unz.description: UNZ is a Fujitsu FM Towns and FM Marty emulator.

uosnes.name: uosnes
uosnes.author: sanmaiwashi
uosnes.description: uosnes is a Nintendo SNES and Super Famicom emulator.

uoyabause.name: uoYabause
uoyabause.author: uoYabause Team
uoyabause.description: uoYabause is a unofficial port of Yabause SEGA Saturn Emulator.This project is focused on the Android version of yabause using OpenGL ES 3.x.

vace.name: Vace
vace.author: Edward Patel
vace.description: Vace is a Jupiter Cantab Jupiter Ace emulator.

vace3d.name: Vace3D
vace3d.author: Edward Patel
vace3d.description: Vace3D is a Jupiter Cantab Jupiter Ace emulator. This is a truly weird emulator as the Computer and Screen are rendered in a 3D environment! It is hard to use and is mainly here for novelty value.

vaquarius.name: Virtual Aquarius
vaquarius.author: James the Animal Tamer
vaquarius.description: Virtual Aquarius is an emulator for the Radofin Electronics Aquarius Home Computer System.

vb64.name: VB64

vbjin.name: VBjin

vbjin.description: VBjin is a Nintendo Virtual Boy emulator.

vbjin-ovr.description: VBjin-OVR is a Virtual Boy Emulator for Windows with support for the Oculus Rift VR display device.

vdmgr.name: vdmgr
vdmgr.author: lsluk
vdmgr.description: Vdmgr is a multi-system emulator that emulates the NES, NeoGeo Pocket, Sega SG-1000 / Mark III, MCS BASIC-52, TD 4, GMC-4, Z80 computers and MSX.

vecx.name: vecx

vecxgl.description: VecXGL is a GCE Vectrex emulator based on vecx by Valavan Manohararajah.

vgb.description: Virtual GameBoy (VGB) is an emulator of the Nintendo Game Boy, Super Game Boy and Game Boy Color.

vgba.name: Virtual GameBoy Advance
vgba.author: Marat Fayzullin
vgba.description: Virtual GameBoy Advance is a Nintendo Game Boy Advance emulator.

vic20emu.name: Vic-20

vic20emu.description: Vic-20 Emulator is a Commodore Vic-20 emulator and debugger. NOTE: Ensure the correct filepath to your Java installation is set in the 'runemu.bat' file.

vinter.name: Virtual Interact
vinter.author: James the Animal Tamer
vinter.description: Virtual Interact, an emulator for the Interact Family Computer

virtpanajr.name: Virtual Panasonic JR-200U
virtpanajr.author: James the Animal Tamer
virtpanajr.description: Virtual Panasonic JR-200U is an emulator for the Panasonic JR-200U.

virtu.name: Virtu
virtu.author: fool and sicklittlemonkey
virtu.description: Virtu is an Apple IIe emulator for the .NET Framework using C# with WPF.

virtualapf.name: Virtual APF

virtualjaguar.author: Niels Wagenaar & Carwin Jones
virtualjaguar.description: Virtual Jaguar GCC/SDL portable Jaguar emulator which is based on the source code released by David Raingeard (Cal2) of what used to be Potato Emulation

virtualmc10.name: Virtual MC-10

virtualmc10.author: James the Animal Tamer
virtualmc10.description: Virtual MC-10, an emulator for the Radio Shack TRS-80 Microcolor Computer MC-10 and Ordinateur Alice.

virtualnectrek.name: Virtual NEC Trek
virtualnectrek.author: James the Animal Tamer
virtualnectrek.description: Virtual NEC Trek, an emulator for the NEC Trek (aka NEC PC-6001A).

virtualt.name: Virtual T
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer
virtualt.author: Ken Pettit
virtualt.description: Virtual T is a TRS-80 Model 100/102/200 emulator that runs on Windows, Linux, and Macintosh. The goal of Virtual T is to provide 100% hardware emulation so any existing programs will run. It also adds powerful development and debugging tools.

virtuanes.name: VirtuaNES
virtuanes.author: Norix
virtuanes.description: VirtuaNES is an emulator for the Nintendo NES and Famicom. The website is a mixture of English and Japanese.

virtuanesplus.name: VirtuaNES Plus
virtuanesplus.author: Tensai Wang
virtuanesplus.description: VirtuaNES Plus is an emulator for the Nintendo NES and Famicom based on VirtuaNES but containing updated Mappers (mainly for Asian games). The website is a mixture of English and Japanese.

visualboy.name: VisualBoy
visualboy.author: Forgotten
visualboy.description: VisualBoy has a very high compatibility rate, performance is excellent and it supports all incarnations of the GameBoy. However, development of this emulator has been discontinued and it is now considered an integrated component of VisualBoy Advance. This emulator requires Direct X 7.0 or above.

visualboyadvance-m.name: VisualBoyAdvance-M-WX
visualboyadvance-m.author: The VBA-M development team
visualboyadvance-m.description: VisualBoyAdvance-M-WX is a Nintendo Game Boy and Game Boy Advance emulator. It is a fork of VisualBoyAdvance.

visualboyadvance.name: VisualBoyAdvance
visualboyadvance.author: Forgotten & kxu
visualboyadvance.description: VisualBoyAdvance - a Gameboy and GameboyAdvance emulator

visualboyadvance-rr.name: VisualBoyAdvance ReRecording
visualboyadvance-rr.author: adelikat, DarkKobold, gocha, klmz, nitsuja, P.JBoy
visualboyadvance-rr.description: VBA-ReRecording is the re-recording branch of the stable 1.7.2 version of VisualBoyAdvance, The primary function of this branch is to expand features related to the creation of Tool-assisted movies.

visualpinball.name: Visual Pinball
visualpinball.author: Randy Davis
visualpinball.description: Visual Pinball can more or less faithfully reproduce the gameplay of most pinball tables created before 1990.  More modern tables tend to use complicated engineering which is beyond that supported by VP.  Of course, every table has it's own gimmicks, which usually can be reproduced with varying degrees of success.

vivanonno.name: viva nonno
vivanonno.author: Karl Stenerud
vivanonno.description: viva nonno is a namco system 22 emulator for Windows and DirectX.

vss.name: Virtual Super System
vss.author: Daniel Boris
vss.description: VSS is an Atari 5200 Super System emulator for MSDOS. The current version runs about 95% of the ROM images I have almost flawlessly, and at a reasonable speed. To use the emulator you will need a copy of the 5200's 2K BIOS ROM, and 5200 ROM cart images

vzem.name: VZEM
vzem.author: Guy Thomason
vzem.description: VZEM is an emulator for the VZ200/VZ300 computers, also known as the Laser 200/ Laser 310 (Europe), Texet TX8000 (UK), and Salora Fellow (Finland).

wataroo.name: Wataroo
wataroo.author: Osman Celimli
wataroo.description: Wataroo is a Watara SuperVision emulator. It was written after I lost a bet with Brandon Cobb of Super Fighter Team. As with a genuine SuperVision, the best way to use this software is not at all.

whinecube.name: WhineCube
whinecube.author: Masken
whinecube.description: WhineCube is a GameCube emulator. It loads and executes DOL-, ELF- or GCM-format executables with graphics, pad, DVD and sound emulation, and can also provide massive debug logs. It can run at least one commercial game.

win994a.name: Win994a
win994a.author: Cory Burr
win994a.description: Win994a is a TI-99/4A simulator written by Cory Burr that installs and runs in the Windows environment.  It was written to simulate  the TI-99/4A, not to emulate it perfectly.

winape.name: WinAPE
winape.author: Richard Wilson
winape.description: WinAPE is an Amstrad CPC and Amstrad Plus emulator.

winarcadia.name: WinArcadia
winarcadia.author: James Jacobs
winarcadia.description: WinArcadia is a multi-system emulator of these machines: Emerson Arcadia 2001 console family (Bandai, Emerson, Grandstand, Intervision, Leisure-Vision, Leonardo, MPT-03, Ormatu, Palladium, Poppy, Robdajet, Tele-Fever, Tempest, Tryom, Tunix, etc.) (1982); Interton VC 4000 console family (Acetronic, Fountain, Hanimex, Interton, Prinztronic, Radofin, Rowtron, Voltmace, Waddington, etc.) (c. 1978); Elektor TV Games Computer (1979); PIPBUG- and  BINBUG-based machines (Electronics Australia 77up2 and 78up5, Signetics Adaptable Board Computer, Eurocard 2650, etc.) (c. 1977-1978); Signetics Instructor 50 trainer (1978); Central Data 2650 computer (1977); Astro Wars, Galaxia, Laser Battle and Lazarian coin-ops by Zaccaria (1979-1981); Malzak 1 and 2 coin-ops by Kitronix (c. 1980); Chaos 2 computer (1983); Dolphin trainer (1977); PHUNSY computer (c. 1980); AY-3-8550/8600-based Pong systems (c. 1976-1977); Ravensburger Selbstbaucomputer aka 2650 Minimal Computer trainer (1984); MIKIT 2650 trainer (1978); and VTech Type-right machine (1985). .

winboycott.name: WinBoycott
winboycott.author: Julien FRELAT aka Gollum
winboycott.description: WinBoycott has a high compatibility rate and reasonable speed. This emulator is however lacking a full-screen mode and any type of hardware acceleration. Classic GameBoy, Super GameBoy and GameBoy Color are all supported by this emulator. This is a port of the DOS-based GameBoy emulator Boycott.

wincpc.name: WinCPC
wincpc.author: Flynn
wincpc.description: WinCPC is the Borland Delphi port of an Amstrad CPC emulator called vbCPC.

winfellow.name: WinFellow
winfellow.author: Peter Schau, Torsten Enderling and Worfje
winfellow.description: WinFellow is a high performance Amiga Emulator primarily targeted for Windows. Its distinguished API and core do however allow a fairly easy port to other operating systems.

winkawaks.name: WinKawaks
winkawaks.author: The WinKawaks Team
winkawaks.description: WinKawaks is a windows version of Kawaks, an emulator for the Capcom CPS1 and CPS2 and SNK NeoGeo.

wintvc.name: winTVC
wintvc.author: Grsz Attila
wintvc.description: WinTVC is my Videoton TV Computer (TVC) emulator for Windows. The TVC is very similar to the Enterprise 128.

winuae.name: WinUAE
winuae.author: Toni Wilen & WinUAE Team
winuae.description: WinUAE is an Amiga emulator for Windows. WinUAE includes a debugger/monitor called HRTMon, which is built into all WinUAE versions since v1.3 (2006-07-16). It also includes a save state function which can make a raw dump of memory.

winvice.name: WinVICE
winvice.author: The WinVice Team
winvice.description: VICE is a program that emulates the Commodore C64, the Commodore C64DTV, the Commodore C128, the Commodore VIC20, almost all Commodore PET models, the Commodore PLUS4 and the Commodore CBM-II (aka C610).

winvz.name: WinVZ
winvz.author: xip
winvz.description: WinVZ is a Dick Smith VZ200 and VZ300, VTech Laser 200 and Texet 8000 emulator.

winvz300.name: WinVZ300
winvz300.author: Gavin Turner
winvz300.description: Winvz300 is a Classic VZ300 Computer Emulator for Windows that emulates the Dick Smith VZ200 / VZ300 / Salora Fellow / Texet / TX-8000 Sanyo Laser110 / Laser210 / Laser310 computers.

winx1.name: WinX1
winx1.author: Kenjo
winx1.description: WinX1 is a Sharp X-1 series emulator.

wscamp.name: WSCamp
wscamp.author: UNKNOWN
wscamp.description: WSCamp is a Bandai WonderSwan and WonderSwan Color emulator.

x88000.name: X88000
x88000.author: Manuke
x88000.description: X88000 is an NEC PC-8801 emulator.

xe.name: Xe
xe.author: Unknown
xe.description: Xe is a multi system emulator for Windows and Linux that emulates many console and handheld video game systems that are no longer on the market. Xe is an original emulator written from scratch by one person. It is not a port or collection of other emulators.

xebra.name: XEBRA
xebra.author: Dr. Hell
xebra.description: XEBRA is a Sony Playstation 1 and PocketStation emulator. NOTE: To run PocketStation games you need both XEBRA and PK201. Basically, you put both emulators in a folder together with respective FROM, KROM and OSROM files, run PK201 and do the initial setup, select File -> Save STAT and close it. Now you run XEBRA, select whatever game you like, then select Run -> Run-1/2/3 to start the game. When in game, select Run -> Outer Card to start the PocketStation emulation.

xenia.name: xenia
xenia.author: Ben Vanik
xenia.description: xenia is a Microsoft XBOX360 emulator. Screenshot from https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1MearvJgvNw.

xeon.name: Xeon
xeon.author: SF
xeon.description: Xeon is a Microsoft XBox emulator. NOTE: You will need a tool such as xISO to extract the contents of the ISO, making sure that the directory structure of the ISO is preserved. Also, this emulator supposedly ONLY runs Halo (NTSC version).

xm6.name: XM 6 Type G
xm6.author: GIMONS
xm6.description: XM 6 Type G is a Sharp X68000 emulator based on XM 6 by PI.. NOTE: 2.05 version of this emulator is in Japanese.

xm7.name: XM7
xm7.author: PI. and Ryu Takegami
xm7.description: XM7 is an emulator for the Fujitsu FM-7. NOTE: Emulator and Website are in Japanese.

xm7dash.name: XM7dash
xm7dash.author: PI., Ryu Takegami and Toma
xm7dash.description: XM7dash is an emulator for the Fujitsu FM-7. NOTE: Emulator and Website are in Japanese.

xm8.name: XM8
xm8.author: PI.
xm8.description: XM8 is an NEC PC-8801 emulator. NOTE: Website is in Japanese.

xmillenium.name: XMillenium
xmillenium.author: Adrastea
xmillenium.description: XMillenium is a Sharp X-1 series emulator based on X1EMU.

xpeccy.name: Xpeccy
xpeccy.author: SAM style
xpeccy.description: Xpeccy is a ZX Spectrum, Russian Clone and MSX-1 emulator. NOTE: BIOS images are required for ALL emulated systems except for the 48K Spectrum. These files must be placed in a 'roms' subdirectory and the emulator configured accordingly (Right-Click on screen to access menu).

xqemu.name: XQEMU
xqemu.author: espes
xqemu.description: XQEMU is a Microsoft XBox emulator. NOTE: This emulator is very complicated to get working. Screenshot from Author's Website.

xroar.name: XRoar
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer
xroar.author: Ciaran Anscomb
xroar.description: XRoar is an emulator for the following systems: DragonData Dragon 32, Dragon 64, Dragon 200-E, Tandy CoCo (Color Computer) 1 & 2, and compatibles.

xroar coco 2 ntsc.name: XRoar CoCo 2 NTSC
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer

xroar coco 2 pal.name: XRoar CoCo 2 PAL
platforms: Tandy Radio Shack TRS-80 Color Computer

xsnes.name: xSnes
xsnes.author: Julian Goracke
xsnes.description: Derived from higan v094 higan/bsnes Developed by "byuu" ,The idea behind the xSnes fork of higan/bsnes is to preserve and separate the near perfect Super Nintendo portion from the multi-emulator known as higan.

yabause.name: Yabause
yabause.author: Yabouse Team
yabause.description: SSF is a Windows-based emulator of the Sega Saturn and Sega Titan Video (ST-V, an arcade board very similar to the Saturn). Despite the historical difficulty of emulating the Saturn's rather idiosyncratic and complex architecture, and the fact that SSF is developed by a sole developer (Shima), it has overtaken other Saturn emulators to the point of being able to run the majority of games with few to no issues. It is designed to run game CDs directly, so images must be mounted with a virtual drive program (e.g. Daemon Tools) in order to be played.

yabaused.name: Yabause-Devmiyax
yabaused.author: Benjamin Siskoo
yabaused.description: Yabause-Devmiyax is a Sega Saturn emulator based on Yabause.

yage.name: YAGE
yage.author: Antoine Pitrou
yage.description: YAPE is a Commodore 264 family emulator. It's an 8-bit microcomputer family from the once-great-now-defunct Commodore Business Machines Ltd. They were released as a successor to the immensely popular Commodore 64 supposedly to either compete with the ZX Spectrum or other micros but eventually failed to gain market success and the whole line was dumped within a couple of years. However they were hugely popular in a few countries such as Hungary, Germany or Italy (to a certain extent also in the UK).

yanese.name: YANESE (Yet Another NES Emulator)
yanese.author: Anes
yanese.description: YANESE (Yet Another NES Emulator) is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator.

yape.name: Yet Another Plus/4 Emulator
yape.author: Attila Grosz
yape.description: YAPE is a Commodore 264 family emulator. It's an 8-bit microcomputer family from the once-great-now-defunct Commodore Business Machines Ltd. They were released as a successor to the immensely popular Commodore 64 supposedly to either compete with the ZX Spectrum or other micros but eventually failed to gain market success and the whole line was dumped within a couple of years. However they were hugely popular in a few countries such as Hungary, Germany or Italy (to a certain extent also in the UK).

yapesdl.name: Yet Another Plus/4 Emulator SDL
yapesdl.author: Attila Grosz
yapesdl.description: yapeSDL is a Commodore plus/4 and 64 family emulator based on YAPE.

yoshines.name: YoshiNES
yoshines.author: omundodogabriel
yoshines.description: YoshiNES is a Nintendo Entertainment System emulator written in Visual Basic. It is a modification of BasicNES by Don Jarret and David Finch. The emulator is in Portuguese but has an option for English.

z26.name: Z26
z26.author: John Saeger
z26.description: This version of z26 is designed to run natively on 32-bit x86 Windows platforms. It provides excellent sound quality, and correct frame synchronization on Windows-XP platforms.

z80stealth.name: Z80Stealth
z80stealth.author: Kirill Kolpakov
z80stealth.description: Z80Stealth is a Sinclair ZX Spectrum and Russian Clones emulator. NOTE: The Author's Website is a mixture of Russian and English.

zboy.name: zBoy
zboy.author: Mateusz Viste
zboy.description: zBoy is a Nintendo Game Boy emulator.

zero.name: Zero
zero.author: Arjun Nair
zero.description: Zero is a Sinclair ZX Spectrum and Pentagon 128K emulator.

zesarux.name: ZEsarUX
zesarux.author: Cesar Hernandez
zesarux.description: ZEsarUX is an emulator for the Sinclair ZX Spectrum, ZX81 and ZX80, the Cambridge Z88, the Jupiter Ace, the Chloe 140 SE and 280 SE, the Prism, the Timex TS 2068, the TBBlue / ZX Spectrum Next, the Sam Coupe and the Amstrad CPC 464.

zinc.name: ZiNc
zinc.author: The_Author and DynaChicken
zinc.description: ZiNc is an emulator for various arcade games which ran on modified Sony PlayStation hardware. It does not emulate any other games, including other 3D games.

zsnes.name: ZSNES
zsnes.author: zsKnight, -Demo-, and Pharos
zsnes.description: ZSNES is a Super Nintendo emulator programmed by zsKnight and -Demo-. On April 2, 2001 the ZSNES project was GPL'ed and its source released to the public.

zxspin.name: ZXSpin
zxspin.author: Paul Dunn and Mark Woodmass
zxspin.description: ZXSpin is a Sinclair ZX Spectrum and Pentagon emulator.

1964.author: Joel Middendorf (schibo) & Rice
1964.description: 1964 as the name dictates is a Nintendo64 emulator with high compatibility. Best used for optimum performance with Pentium 4 based PC's or better, written in C/C++ and released as free software. It is one of the oldest and most popular N64 emulators, supporting many commercial N64 games.
